1â†’#!/usr/bin/env python3
     2â†’"""Quality evaluation script for the unified pipeline.
     3â†’
     4â†’Uploads sample PDFs through the running Docker Compose stack, waits for
     5â†’pipeline completion, queries results via the API, computes statistics,
     6â†’runs an LLM heuristic assessment, and generates a structured markdown report.
     7â†’
     8â†’Usage:
     9â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py              # Upload + evaluate
    10â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py --fresh      # Force re-upload
    11â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py --skip-upload # Use existing data
    12â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py --protocol-ids id1,id2
    13â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py --skip-llm   # Skip LLM assessment
    14â†’    uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py --report-name my_report.md
    15â†’"""
    16â†’
    17â†’from __future__ import annotations
    18â†’
    19â†’import argparse
    20â†’import base64
    21â†’import os
    22â†’import sys
    23â†’import time
    24â†’from collections import Counter
    25â†’from datetime import datetime, timezone
    26â†’from pathlib import Path
    27â†’from statistics import mean, median
    28â†’
    29â†’import httpx
    30â†’import jwt
    31â†’
    32â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    33â†’# Configuration
    34â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    35â†’
    36â†’# Allow running as `uv run python scripts/quality_eval.py` from repo root
    37â†’_REPO_ROOT = Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent
    38â†’
    39â†’sys.path.insert(0, str(_REPO_ROOT / "scripts"))
    40â†’
    41â†’from quality_eval_config import (  # noqa: E402
    42â†’    API_URL,
    43â†’    JWT_SECRET,
    44â†’    PIPELINE_TIMEOUT,
    45â†’    REPORT_OUTPUT_DIR,
    46â†’    SAMPLE_PDFS,
    47â†’)
    48â†’
    49â†’# Terminal statuses (same as tests/e2e/conftest.py)
    50â†’_TERMINAL_STATUSES = frozenset(
    51â†’    {
    52â†’        "pending_review",
    53â†’        "complete",
    54â†’        "extraction_failed",
    55â†’        "grounding_failed",
    56â†’        "pipeline_failed",
    57â†’        "dead_letter",
    58â†’    }
    59â†’)
    60â†’
    61â†’
    62â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    63â†’# Helpers
    64â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    65â†’
    66â†’
    67â†’def _build_client() -> httpx.Client:
    68â†’    """Create an authenticated httpx client with a JWT bearer token."""
    69â†’    token = jwt.encode(
    70â†’        {"sub": "quality-eval", "email": "eval@system.local", "name": "Quality Eval"},
    71â†’        JWT_SECRET,
    72â†’        algorithm="HS256",
    73â†’    )
    74â†’    return httpx.Client(
    75â†’        base_url=API_URL,
    76â†’        headers={"Authorization": f"Bearer {token}"},
    77â†’        timeout=60.0,
    78â†’    )
    79â†’
    80â†’
    81â†’def _wait_for_pipeline(
    82â†’    client: httpx.Client,
    83â†’    protocol_id: str,
    84â†’    timeout: int = PIPELINE_TIMEOUT,
    85â†’    poll_interval: int = 5,
    86â†’) -> dict:
    87â†’    """Poll protocol status until it reaches a terminal state."""
    88â†’    deadline = time.monotonic() + timeout
    89â†’    while True:
    90â†’        resp = client.get(f"/protocols/{protocol_id}")
    91â†’        resp.raise_for_status()
    92â†’        data = resp.json()
    93â†’
    94â†’        status = data.get("status", "")
    95â†’        elapsed = int(timeout - (deadline - time.monotonic()))
    96â†’        print(
    97â†’            f"    Waiting for pipeline (protocol {protocol_id[:8]}...)..."
    98â†’            f" status: {status} ({elapsed}s)"
    99â†’        )
   100â†’
   101â†’        if status in _TERMINAL_STATUSES:
   102â†’            return data
   103â†’
   104â†’        if time.monotonic() > deadline:
   105â†’            raise TimeoutError(
   106â†’                f"Protocol {protocol_id} still in '{status}' after {timeout}s"
   107â†’            )
   108â†’
   109â†’        time.sleep(poll_interval)
   110â†’
   111â†’
   112â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   113â†’# Step 1: Upload and process PDFs
   114â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   115â†’
   116â†’
   117â†’def upload_pdf(client: httpx.Client, pdf_path: str) -> str:
   118â†’    """Upload a single PDF through the three-step flow. Returns protocol_id."""
   119â†’    path = _REPO_ROOT / pdf_path
   120â†’    if not path.exists():
   121â†’        raise FileNotFoundError(f"PDF not found: {path}")
   122â†’
   123â†’    pdf_bytes = path.read_bytes()
   124â†’
   125â†’    # Step 1: Request upload URL
   126â†’    resp = client.post(
   127â†’        "/protocols/upload",
   128â†’        json={
   129â†’            "filename": path.name,
   130â†’            "content_type": "application/pdf",
   131â†’            "file_size_bytes": len(pdf_bytes),
   132â†’        },
   133â†’    )
   134â†’    resp.raise_for_status()
   135â†’    data = resp.json()
   136â†’    protocol_id = data["protocol_id"]
   137â†’    upload_url = data["upload_url"]
   138â†’
   139â†’    # Step 2: PUT the PDF bytes to the upload URL
   140â†’    put_resp = httpx.put(
   141â†’        upload_url,
   142â†’        content=pdf_bytes,
   143â†’        headers={"Content-Type": "application/pdf"},
   144â†’        timeout=30.0,
   145â†’    )
   146â†’    put_resp.raise_for_status()
   147â†’
   148â†’    # Step 3: Confirm upload with base64 PDF
   149â†’    pdf_b64 = base64.b64encode(pdf_bytes).decode("ascii")
   150â†’    confirm_resp = client.post(
   151â†’        f"/protocols/{protocol_id}/confirm-upload",
   152â†’        json={"pdf_bytes_base64": pdf_b64},
   153â†’    )
   154â†’    confirm_resp.raise_for_status()
   155â†’
   156â†’    return protocol_id
   157â†’
   158â†’
   159â†’def upload_and_process(
   160â†’    client: httpx.Client, fresh: bool = False
   161â†’) -> list[dict]:
   162â†’    """Upload sample PDFs and wait for pipeline completion.
   163â†’
   164â†’    Returns list of dicts with protocol_id, status, and title for each PDF.
   165â†’    """
   166â†’    results: list[dict] = []
   167â†’    total_pdfs = len(SAMPLE_PDFS)
   168â†’
   169â†’    for idx, pdf_path in enumerate(SAMPLE_PDFS, 1):
   170â†’        pdf_name = Path(pdf_path).name
   171â†’        print(f"  Uploading PDF {idx}/{total_pdfs}: {pdf_name}...")
   172â†’
   173â†’        try:
   174â†’            protocol_id = upload_pdf(client, pdf_path)
   175â†’            print(
   176â†’                f"  [{pdf_name}] protocol_id={protocol_id},"
   177â†’                " waiting for pipeline..."
   178â†’            )
   179â†’
   180â†’            start = time.monotonic()
   181â†’            final = _wait_for_pipeline(client, protocol_id)
   182â†’            elapsed = int(time.monotonic() - start)
   183â†’            status = final.get("status", "unknown")
   184â†’            title = final.get("title", pdf_name)
   185â†’            print(
   186â†’                f"  Pipeline complete for protocol {protocol_id[:8]}..."
   187â†’                f" (status: {status}, {elapsed}s)"
   188â†’            )
   189â†’
   190â†’            results.append(
   191â†’                {
   192â†’                    "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   193â†’                    "status": status,
   194â†’                    "title": title,
   195â†’                    "pdf_path": pdf_path,
   196â†’                }
   197â†’            )
   198â†’        except Exception as exc:
   199â†’            print(f"  [{pdf_name}] ERROR: {exc}")
   200â†’            results.append(
   201â†’                {
   202â†’                    "protocol_id": None,
   203â†’                    "status": "error",
   204â†’                    "title": pdf_name,
   205â†’                    "pdf_path": pdf_path,
   206â†’                    "error": str(exc),
   207â†’                }
   208â†’            )
   209â†’
   210â†’    return results
   211â†’
   212â†’
   213â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   214â†’# Step 2: Collect results via API
   215â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   216â†’
   217â†’
   218â†’def collect_criteria(
   219â†’    client: httpx.Client, protocol_id: str
   220â†’) -> list[dict]:
   221â†’    """Fetch all criteria + entities for a protocol via the API."""
   222â†’    print(f"  Collecting results for protocol {protocol_id[:8]}...")
   223â†’
   224â†’    # Get batches for the protocol
   225â†’    resp = client.get(f"/protocols/{protocol_id}/batches")
   226â†’    resp.raise_for_status()
   227â†’    batches = resp.json()
   228â†’
   229â†’    if isinstance(batches, dict):
   230â†’        # Paginated response
   231â†’        batches = batches.get("items", [])
   232â†’
   233â†’    all_criteria: list[dict] = []
   234â†’    for batch in batches:
   235â†’        batch_id = batch["id"]
   236â†’        cr_resp = client.get(f"/reviews/batches/{batch_id}/criteria")
   237â†’        cr_resp.raise_for_status()
   238â†’        criteria_list = cr_resp.json()
   239â†’        for criterion in criteria_list:
   240â†’            criterion["_batch_id"] = batch_id
   241â†’            criterion["_protocol_id"] = protocol_id
   242â†’        all_criteria.extend(criteria_list)
   243â†’
   244â†’    return all_criteria
   245â†’
   246â†’
   247â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   248â†’# Step 3: Compute statistics
   249â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   250â†’
   251â†’
   252â†’def _extract_entities(criteria_list: list[dict]) -> list[dict]:
   253â†’    """Flatten entities from a criteria list."""
   254â†’    entities: list[dict] = []
   255â†’    for criterion in criteria_list:
   256â†’        entities.extend(criterion.get("entities", []))
   257â†’    return entities
   258â†’
   259â†’
   260â†’def compute_per_protocol_stats(
   261â†’    protocol_id: str, criteria_list: list[dict]
   262â†’) -> dict:
   263â†’    """Compute per-protocol statistics."""
   264â†’    entities = _extract_entities(criteria_list)
   265â†’
   266â†’    inclusion_count = sum(
   267â†’        1 for c in criteria_list if c.get("criteria_type") == "inclusion"
   268â†’    )
   269â†’    exclusion_count = sum(
   270â†’        1 for c in criteria_list if c.get("criteria_type") == "exclusion"
   271â†’    )
   272â†’
   273â†’    cui_count = sum(1 for e in entities if e.get("umls_cui"))
   274â†’    total_entities = len(entities)
   275â†’    cui_rate = cui_count / total_entities if total_entities > 0 else 0.0
   276â†’
   277â†’    method_counter: Counter = Counter()
   278â†’    for e in entities:
   279â†’        method = e.get("grounding_method") or "none"
   280â†’        method_counter[method] += 1
   281â†’
   282â†’    return {
   283â†’        "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   284â†’        "criteria_count": len(criteria_list),
   285â†’        "inclusion_count": inclusion_count,
   286â†’        "exclusion_count": exclusion_count,
   287â†’        "entity_count": total_entities,
   288â†’        "cui_rate": cui_rate,
   289â†’        "grounding_method_distribution": dict(method_counter),
   290â†’    }
   291â†’
   292â†’
   293â†’def compute_aggregate_stats(all_entities: list[dict]) -> dict:
   294â†’    """Compute aggregate statistics across all entities."""
   295â†’    confidences = [
   296â†’        e["grounding_confidence"]
   297â†’        for e in all_entities
   298â†’        if e.get("grounding_confidence") is not None
   299â†’    ]
   300â†’
   301â†’    total = len(all_entities)
   302â†’    cui_count = sum(1 for e in all_entities if e.get("umls_cui"))
   303â†’
   304â†’    entity_type_counter: Counter = Counter()
   305â†’    for e in all_entities:
   306â†’        entity_type_counter[e.get("entity_type", "unknown")] += 1
   307â†’
   308â†’    return {
   309â†’        "mean_confidence": mean(confidences) if confidences else 0.0,
   310â†’        "median_confidence": median(confidences) if confidences else 0.0,
   311â†’        "overall_cui_rate": cui_count / total if total > 0 else 0.0,
   312â†’        "entity_type_distribution": dict(entity_type_counter),
   313â†’        "total_entities": total,
   314â†’    }
   315â†’
   316â†’
   317â†’def compute_confidence_distribution(all_entities: list[dict]) -> dict:
   318â†’    """Compute confidence distribution across buckets."""
   319â†’    buckets = {
   320â†’        "null/zero": 0,
   321â†’        "0-0.5": 0,
   322â†’        "0.5-0.7": 0,
   323â†’        "0.7-0.9": 0,
   324â†’        "0.9-1.0": 0,
   325â†’    }
   326â†’
   327â†’    for e in all_entities:
   328â†’        conf = e.get("grounding_confidence")
   329â†’        if conf is None or conf == 0:
   330â†’            buckets["null/zero"] += 1
   331â†’        elif conf < 0.5:
   332â†’            buckets["0-0.5"] += 1
   333â†’        elif conf < 0.7:
   334â†’            buckets["0.5-0.7"] += 1
   335â†’        elif conf < 0.9:
   336â†’            buckets["0.7-0.9"] += 1
   337â†’        else:
   338â†’            buckets["0.9-1.0"] += 1
   339â†’
   340â†’    total = len(all_entities)
   341â†’    result: dict = {}
   342â†’    for label, count in buckets.items():
   343â†’        pct = (count / total * 100) if total > 0 else 0.0
   344â†’        result[label] = {"count": count, "percentage": round(pct, 1)}
   345â†’
   346â†’    return result
   347â†’
   348â†’
   349â†’def compute_terminology_success(all_entities: list[dict]) -> dict:
   350â†’    """Compute per-terminology-system grounding success rates."""
   351â†’    total = len(all_entities)
   352â†’
   353â†’    systems = {
   354â†’        "UMLS": "umls_cui",
   355â†’        "SNOMED": "snomed_code",
   356â†’        "RxNorm": "rxnorm_code",
   357â†’        "ICD-10": "icd10_code",
   358â†’        "LOINC": "loinc_code",
   359â†’        "HPO": "hpo_code",
   360â†’    }
   361â†’
   362â†’    result: dict = {}
   363â†’    for system_name, field in systems.items():
   364â†’        count = sum(1 for e in all_entities if e.get(field))
   365â†’        rate = count / total if total > 0 else 0.0
   366â†’        result[system_name] = {"count": count, "rate": round(rate * 100, 1)}
   367â†’
   368â†’    return result
   369â†’
   370â†’
   371â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   372â†’# Bug Catalog (identifies pipeline problems for triage)
   373â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   374â†’
   375â†’_TERMINOLOGY_CODE_FIELDS = (
   376â†’    "snomed_code",
   377â†’    "rxnorm_code",
   378â†’    "icd10_code",
   379â†’    "loinc_code",
   380â†’    "hpo_code",
   381â†’)
   382â†’
   383â†’
   384â†’def _find_ungrounded_entities(
   385â†’    all_criteria_by_protocol: dict[str, list[dict]],
   386â†’) -> list[dict]:
   387â†’    """Find entities with no UMLS CUI and no terminology codes."""
   388â†’    issues: list[dict] = []
   389â†’    for protocol_id, criteria_list in all_criteria_by_protocol.items():
   390â†’        for criterion in criteria_list:
   391â†’            criterion_text = (criterion.get("criteria_text") or "")[:80]
   392â†’            for entity in criterion.get("entities", []):
   393â†’                has_cui = bool(entity.get("umls_cui"))
   394â†’                has_code = any(
   395â†’                    entity.get(field) for field in _TERMINOLOGY_CODE_FIELDS
   396â†’                )
   397â†’                if has_cui or has_code:
   398â†’                    continue
   399â†’
   400â†’                confidence = entity.get("grounding_confidence")
   401â†’                if confidence is not None and confidence >= 0.5:
   402â†’                    # Has some confidence but no codes â€” shouldn't happen often
   403â†’                    # but not flagged by the spec
   404â†’                    continue
   405â†’
   406â†’                if confidence is not None and 0 < confidence < 0.5:
   407â†’                    severity = "warning"
   408â†’                else:
   409â†’                    severity = "critical"
   410â†’
   411â†’                issues.append(
   412â†’                    {
   413â†’                        "type": "ungrounded_entities",
   414â†’                        "severity": severity,
   415â†’                        "entity_text": entity.get("entity_text", ""),
   416â†’                        "entity_type": entity.get("entity_type", "unknown"),
   417â†’                        "criterion_text": criterion_text,
   418â†’                        "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   419â†’                        "grounding_method": entity.get("grounding_method"),
   420â†’                        "grounding_confidence": confidence,
   421â†’                    }
   422â†’                )
   423â†’    return issues
   424â†’
   425â†’
   426â†’def _find_pipeline_errors(protocol_results: list[dict]) -> list[dict]:
   427â†’    """Find protocols with error statuses."""
   428â†’    error_statuses = {
   429â†’        "extraction_failed",
   430â†’        "grounding_failed",
   431â†’        "pipeline_failed",
   432â†’        "dead_letter",
   433â†’    }
   434â†’    issues: list[dict] = []
   435â†’    for result in protocol_results:
   436â†’        status = result.get("status", "")
   437â†’        if status in error_statuses:
   438â†’            issues.append(
   439â†’                {
   440â†’                    "type": "pipeline_errors",
   441â†’                    "severity": "critical",
   442â†’                    "protocol_id": result.get("protocol_id", ""),
   443â†’                    "title": result.get("title", "Unknown"),
   444â†’                    "status": status,
   445â†’                    "error": result.get("error", ""),
   446â†’                }
   447â†’            )
   448â†’    return issues
   449â†’
   450â†’
   451â†’def _find_structural_issues(
   452â†’    all_criteria_by_protocol: dict[str, list[dict]],
   453â†’) -> list[dict]:
   454â†’    """Find criteria with zero entities or unknown criteria types."""
   455â†’    issues: list[dict] = []
   456â†’    valid_types = {"inclusion", "exclusion"}
   457â†’
   458â†’    for protocol_id, criteria_list in all_criteria_by_protocol.items():
   459â†’        for criterion in criteria_list:
   460â†’            criterion_text = (criterion.get("criteria_text") or "")[:80]
   461â†’            criteria_type = criterion.get("criteria_type", "unknown")
   462â†’            entities = criterion.get("entities", [])
   463â†’
   464â†’            # Criteria with zero entities
   465â†’            if not entities:
   466â†’                issues.append(
   467â†’                    {
   468â†’                        "type": "structural_issues",
   469â†’                        "severity": "warning",
   470â†’                        "criterion_text": criterion_text,
   471â†’                        "criteria_type": criteria_type,
   472â†’                        "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   473â†’                        "issue": "no_entities",
   474â†’                    }
   475â†’                )
   476â†’
   477â†’            # Unknown criteria type
   478â†’            if criteria_type not in valid_types:
   479â†’                issues.append(
   480â†’                    {
   481â†’                        "type": "structural_issues",
   482â†’                        "severity": "info",
   483â†’                        "criterion_text": criterion_text,
   484â†’                        "criteria_type": criteria_type,
   485â†’                        "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   486â†’                        "issue": "unknown_criteria_type",
   487â†’                    }
   488â†’                )
   489â†’
   490â†’    return issues
   491â†’
   492â†’
   493â†’def catalog_bugs(
   494â†’    protocol_results: list[dict],
   495â†’    all_criteria_by_protocol: dict[str, list[dict]],
   496â†’) -> dict:
   497â†’    """Build a bug catalog from pipeline results and criteria data.
   498â†’
   499â†’    Returns a structured dict with keys: ungrounded_entities, pipeline_errors,
   500â†’    structural_issues, summary.
   501â†’    """
   502â†’    ungrounded = _find_ungrounded_entities(all_criteria_by_protocol)
   503â†’    pipeline_errors = _find_pipeline_errors(protocol_results)
   504â†’    structural = _find_structural_issues(all_criteria_by_protocol)
   505â†’
   506â†’    all_issues = ungrounded + pipeline_errors + structural
   507â†’
   508â†’    by_severity: dict[str, int] = {}
   509â†’    for issue in all_issues:
   510â†’        sev = issue["severity"]
   511â†’        by_severity[sev] = by_severity.get(sev, 0) + 1
   512â†’
   513â†’    by_type: dict[str, int] = {
   514â†’        "ungrounded_entities": len(ungrounded),
   515â†’        "pipeline_errors": len(pipeline_errors),
   516â†’        "structural_issues": len(structural),
   517â†’    }
   518â†’
   519â†’    return {
   520â†’        "ungrounded_entities": ungrounded,
   521â†’        "pipeline_errors": pipeline_errors,
   522â†’        "structural_issues": structural,
   523â†’        "summary": {
   524â†’            "total_issues": len(all_issues),
   525â†’            "by_severity": by_severity,
   526â†’            "by_type": by_type,
   527â†’        },
   528â†’    }
   529â†’
   530â†’
   531â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   532â†’# LLM Heuristic Assessment (QUAL-07)
   533â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   534â†’
   535â†’_LLM_ASSESSMENT_PROMPT = """\
   536â†’You are evaluating the quality of an automated clinical trial criteria \
   537â†’extraction and medical entity grounding pipeline. You are given the actual \
   538â†’output from processing {n} clinical trial protocol PDFs.
   539â†’
   540â†’## Pipeline Output Summary
   541â†’{stats_summary}
   542â†’
   543â†’## Sample Extracted Criteria with Entities
   544â†’{criteria_samples}
   545â†’
   546â†’## Your Assessment
   547â†’
   548â†’Evaluate the following dimensions. Be specific -- reference actual criteria \
   549â†’text and entity examples from above.
   550â†’
   551â†’### Extraction Completeness
   552â†’Are all medical entities in the criteria text captured? Identify any obvious \
   553â†’missed entities by quoting the criteria text.
   554â†’
   555â†’### Grounding Accuracy
   556â†’For grounded entities, do the terminology codes seem correct? Flag any \
   557â†’obvious mismatches (e.g., a medication mapped to a condition code).
   558â†’
   559â†’### Coverage Gaps
   560â†’Which entity types or terminology systems have low/zero coverage? \
   561â†’Hypothesize why.
   562â†’
   563â†’### Overall Quality Rating
   564â†’Rate: Excellent / Good / Fair / Poor
   565â†’Provide 2-3 sentences of reasoning.
   566â†’"""
   567â†’
   568â†’
   569â†’def _build_stats_summary(
   570â†’    stats: dict,
   571â†’    per_protocol_stats: list[dict],
   572â†’    terminology: dict,
   573â†’    confidence_dist: dict,
   574â†’    total_criteria: int,
   575â†’) -> str:
   576â†’    """Build a text summary of pipeline stats for the LLM prompt."""
   577â†’    lines: list[str] = []
   578â†’    lines.append(f"- Total criteria extracted: {total_criteria}")
   579â†’    lines.append(f"- Total entities: {stats['total_entities']}")
   580â†’    lines.append(
   581â†’        f"- Overall CUI (UMLS) rate: {stats['overall_cui_rate'] * 100:.1f}%"
   582â†’    )
   583â†’    lines.append(f"- Mean grounding confidence: {stats['mean_confidence']:.3f}")
   584â†’    lines.append(
   585â†’        f"- Median grounding confidence: {stats['median_confidence']:.3f}"
   586â†’    )
   587â†’
   588â†’    # Entity type distribution
   589â†’    lines.append("\nEntity type distribution:")
   590â†’    for etype, count in sorted(
   591â†’        stats["entity_type_distribution"].items(),
   592â†’        key=lambda x: x[1],
   593â†’        reverse=True,
   594â†’    ):
   595â†’        lines.append(f"  - {etype}: {count}")
   596â†’
   597â†’    # Per-protocol summary
   598â†’    lines.append("\nPer-protocol breakdown:")
   599â†’    for ps in per_protocol_stats:
   600â†’        lines.append(
   601â†’            f"  - Protocol {ps['protocol_id'][:8]}...: "
   602â†’            f"{ps['criteria_count']} criteria, "
   603â†’            f"{ps['entity_count']} entities, "
   604â†’            f"CUI rate {ps['cui_rate'] * 100:.1f}%"
   605â†’        )
   606â†’
   607â†’    # Terminology coverage
   608â†’    lines.append("\nTerminology system coverage:")
   609â†’    for system_name in ["UMLS", "SNOMED", "RxNorm", "ICD-10", "LOINC", "HPO"]:
   610â†’        info = terminology.get(system_name, {"count": 0, "rate": 0.0})
   611â†’        lines.append(f"  - {system_name}: {info['count']} entities ({info['rate']}%)")
   612â†’
   613â†’    # Confidence distribution
   614â†’    lines.append("\nConfidence distribution:")
   615â†’    for bucket_name in ["null/zero", "0-0.5", "0.5-0.7", "0.7-0.9", "0.9-1.0"]:
   616â†’        info = confidence_dist.get(bucket_name, {"count": 0, "percentage": 0.0})
   617â†’        lines.append(f"  - {bucket_name}: {info['count']} ({info['percentage']}%)")
   618â†’
   619â†’    return "\n".join(lines)
   620â†’
   621â†’
   622â†’def _build_criteria_samples(
   623â†’    all_criteria_by_protocol: dict[str, list[dict]],
   624â†’    max_criteria: int = 20,
   625â†’) -> str:
   626â†’    """Build sample criteria text with entities for the LLM prompt.
   627â†’
   628â†’    Selects up to max_criteria representative criteria across protocols,
   629â†’    prioritizing criteria that have entities to give the LLM useful context.
   630â†’    """
   631â†’    samples: list[str] = []
   632â†’    remaining = max_criteria
   633â†’
   634â†’    for protocol_id, criteria_list in all_criteria_by_protocol.items():
   635â†’        if remaining <= 0:
   636â†’            break
   637â†’
   638â†’        # Take a proportional share from each protocol, at least 2
   639â†’        share = max(2, remaining // max(1, len(all_criteria_by_protocol)))
   640â†’
   641â†’        # Sort: criteria with entities first (more informative)
   642â†’        sorted_criteria = sorted(
   643â†’            criteria_list,
   644â†’            key=lambda c: len(c.get("entities", [])),
   645â†’            reverse=True,
   646â†’        )
   647â†’
   648â†’        for criterion in sorted_criteria[:share]:
   649â†’            if remaining <= 0:
   650â†’                break
   651â†’
   652â†’            ctype = criterion.get("criteria_type", "unknown")
   653â†’            text = criterion.get("criteria_text", "")[:300]
   654â†’            entities = criterion.get("entities", [])
   655â†’
   656â†’            sample = f"**[{ctype.upper()}]** {text}"
   657â†’            if entities:
   658â†’                sample += "\n  Entities:"
   659â†’                for ent in entities[:5]:  # Limit entities per criterion
   660â†’                    ent_text = ent.get("entity_text", "?")
   661â†’                    ent_type = ent.get("entity_type", "?")
   662â†’                    cui = ent.get("umls_cui", "")
   663â†’                    snomed = ent.get("snomed_code", "")
   664â†’                    rxnorm = ent.get("rxnorm_code", "")
   665â†’                    conf = ent.get("grounding_confidence")
   666â†’
   667â†’                    codes_parts: list[str] = []
   668â†’                    if cui:
   669â†’                        codes_parts.append(f"UMLS:{cui}")
   670â†’                    if snomed:
   671â†’                        codes_parts.append(f"SNOMED:{snomed}")
   672â†’                    if rxnorm:
   673â†’                        codes_parts.append(f"RxNorm:{rxnorm}")
   674â†’                    codes = ", ".join(codes_parts) if codes_parts else "ungrounded"
   675â†’                    conf_str = f", conf={conf:.2f}" if conf is not None else ""
   676â†’
   677â†’                    sample += (
   678â†’                        f"\n    - \"{ent_text}\" ({ent_type}) -> {codes}{conf_str}"
   679â†’                    )
   680â†’                if len(entities) > 5:
   681â†’                    sample += f"\n    - ... and {len(entities) - 5} more entities"
   682â†’            else:
   683â†’                sample += "\n  Entities: (none extracted)"
   684â†’
   685â†’            samples.append(sample)
   686â†’            remaining -= 1
   687â†’
   688â†’    return "\n\n".join(samples) if samples else "(No criteria available for sampling)"
   689â†’
   690â†’
   691â†’def run_llm_assessment(
   692â†’    all_criteria_by_protocol: dict[str, list[dict]],
   693â†’    aggregate_stats: dict,
   694â†’    per_protocol_stats: list[dict],
   695â†’    terminology: dict,
   696â†’    confidence_dist: dict,
   697â†’    total_criteria: int,
   698â†’) -> str:
   699â†’    """Run LLM heuristic assessment of pipeline quality using Gemini.
   700â†’
   701â†’    Returns the LLM's markdown-formatted assessment text, or an error
   702â†’    message if the assessment could not be completed.
   703â†’    """
   704â†’    # Try to import google.genai
   705â†’    try:
   706â†’        from google import genai  # noqa: F811
   707â†’    except ImportError:
   708â†’        return (
   709â†’            "*LLM assessment unavailable: google-genai SDK not installed. "
   710â†’            "Install with `pip install google-genai`.*"
   711â†’        )
   712â†’
   713â†’    # Check for API key
   714â†’    api_key = os.getenv("GOOGLE_API_KEY")
   715â†’    if not api_key:
   716â†’        return (
   717â†’            "*LLM assessment unavailable: GOOGLE_API_KEY environment variable "
   718â†’            "not set. Set it to enable LLM-based quality assessment.*"
   719â†’        )
   720â†’
   721â†’    # Build prompt components
   722â†’    n_protocols = len(all_criteria_by_protocol)
   723â†’    stats_summary = _build_stats_summary(
   724â†’        aggregate_stats,
   725â†’        per_protocol_stats,
   726â†’        terminology,
   727â†’        confidence_dist,
   728â†’        total_criteria,
   729â†’    )
   730â†’    criteria_samples = _build_criteria_samples(all_criteria_by_protocol)
   731â†’
   732â†’    prompt = _LLM_ASSESSMENT_PROMPT.format(
   733â†’        n=n_protocols,
   734â†’        stats_summary=stats_summary,
   735â†’        criteria_samples=criteria_samples,
   736â†’    )
   737â†’
   738â†’    # Call Gemini
   739â†’    model_name = os.getenv("GEMINI_MODEL_NAME", "gemini-2.5-flash")
   740â†’
   741â†’    try:
   742â†’        client = genai.Client(api_key=api_key)
   743â†’        response = client.models.generate_content(
   744â†’            model=model_name,
   745â†’            contents=prompt,
   746â†’            config={
   747â†’                "temperature": 0.3,
   748â†’            },
   749â†’        )
   750â†’        return response.text or "(LLM returned empty response)"
   751â†’    except Exception as exc:
   752â†’        return f"*LLM assessment unavailable: {exc}*"
   753â†’
   754â†’
   755â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   756â†’# Step 4: Generate markdown report
   757â†’# ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
   758â†’
   759â†’
   760â†’def generate_report(
   761â†’    protocol_results: list[dict],
   762â†’    per_protocol_stats: list[dict],
   763â†’    aggregate: dict,
   764â†’    confidence_dist: dict,
   765â†’    terminology: dict,
   766â†’    total_criteria: int,
   767â†’    llm_assessment: str | None = None,
   768â†’    bug_catalog: dict | None = None,
   769â†’) -> str:
   770â†’    """Generate the markdown report content."""
   771â†’    now = datetime.now(timezone.utc).strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S UTC")
   772â†’    pdf_count = len(protocol_results)
   773â†’
   774â†’    lines: list[str] = []
   775â†’    lines.append("# Quality Evaluation Report")
   776â†’    lines.append(f"Generated: {now}")
   777â†’    lines.append(
   778â†’        "Pipeline: unified 5-node LangGraph (ingest->extract->parse->ground->persist)"
   779â†’    )
   780â†’    lines.append(f"PDFs evaluated: {pdf_count}")
   781â†’    lines.append("")
   782â†’
   783â†’    # --- Per-Protocol Statistics ---
   784â†’    lines.append("## Per-Protocol Statistics")
   785â†’    lines.append("")
   786â†’    lines.append(
   787â†’        "| Protocol | Criteria | Inc | Exc | Entities | CUI Rate | Status |"
   788â†’    )
   789â†’    lines.append(
   790â†’        "|----------|----------|-----|-----|----------|----------|--------|"
   791â†’    )
   792â†’
   793â†’    for pr, ps in zip(protocol_results, per_protocol_stats):
   794â†’        title = pr.get("title", "Unknown")[:40]
   795â†’        status = pr.get("status", "unknown")
   796â†’        cui_pct = f"{ps['cui_rate'] * 100:.1f}%"
   797â†’        lines.append(
   798â†’            f"| {title} | {ps['criteria_count']} | {ps['inclusion_count']} "
   799â†’            f"| {ps['exclusion_count']} | {ps['entity_count']} | {cui_pct} "
   800â†’            f"| {status} |"
   801â†’        )
   802â†’
   803â†’    lines.append("")
   804â†’
   805â†’    # --- Grounding Method Distribution ---
   806â†’    lines.append("### Grounding Method Distribution")
   807â†’    lines.append("")
   808â†’
   809â†’    # Collect all methods across protocols
   810â†’    all_methods: set[str] = set()
   811â†’    for ps in per_protocol_stats:
   812â†’        all_methods.update(ps["grounding_method_distribution"].keys())
   813â†’    sorted_methods = sorted(all_methods)
   814â†’
   815â†’    if sorted_methods:
   816â†’        header = "| Protocol | " + " | ".join(sorted_methods) + " |"
   817â†’        sep = "|----------" + "".join("|---------" for _ in sorted_methods) + "|"
   818â†’        lines.append(header)
   819â†’        lines.append(sep)
   820â†’
   821â†’        for pr, ps in zip(protocol_results, per_protocol_stats):
   822â†’            title = pr.get("title", "Unknown")[:40]
   823â†’            dist = ps["grounding_method_distribution"]
   824â†’            values = " | ".join(str(dist.get(m, 0)) for m in sorted_methods)
   825â†’            lines.append(f"| {title} | {values} |")
   826â†’    else:
   827â†’        lines.append("No grounding methods recorded.")
   828â†’
   829â†’    lines.append("")
   830â†’
   831â†’    # --- Aggregate Statistics ---
   832â†’    lines.append("## Aggregate Statistics")
   833â†’    lines.append("")
   834â†’    lines.append("| Metric | Value |")
   835â†’    lines.append("|--------|-------|")
   836â†’    lines.append(f"| Total criteria | {total_criteria} |")

  1087â†’def main() -> None:
  1088â†’    """Run the quality evaluation."""

  1120â†’
  1121â†’    # --protocol-ids implies --skip-upload

  1130â†’    client = _build_client()

  1156â†’        if not ids:

  1163â†’        for pid in ids:

  1177â†’    else:

  1192â†’    # --- Step 2: Collect results ---

  1204â†’

  1214â†’        per_protocol_stats.append(stats)

  1216â†’
  1217â†’    aggregate = compute_aggregate_stats(all_entities)

  1220â†’
  1221â†’    # --- Step 3b: Bug catalog ---
  1222â†’    print("\nStep 3b: Building bug catalog...")
  1223â†’    bug_catalog = catalog_bugs(protocol_results, all_criteria_by_protocol)

  1228â†’
  1229â†’    # --- Step 4: LLM Heuristic Assessment ---

  1236â†’        if not os.getenv("GOOGLE_API_KEY"):

  1258â†’    report_content = generate_report(

  1268â†’
  1269â†’    output_dir = _REPO_ROOT / REPORT_OUTPUT_DIR

  1273â†’
  1274â†’    print(f"\nReport written to {report_path}")

  1277â†’    # Print 3-line summary to stdout

1â†’# Requirements: Clinical Trial Criteria Extraction System
     2â†’
     3â†’**Defined:** 2026-02-17
     4â†’**Core Value:** Clinical researchers can upload a protocol PDF and get accurately extracted, UMLS-grounded eligibility criteria that they can review and approve in a single workflow â€” replacing manual extraction that takes hours per protocol.
     5â†’
     6â†’## v2.1 Requirements
     7â†’
     8â†’Requirements for E2E Testing & Quality Evaluation milestone.
     9â†’
    10â†’### E2E Testing
    11â†’
    12â†’- [ ] **E2E-01**: E2E test can upload a real PDF from data/ and receive extracted criteria via the full Docker Compose pipeline
    13â†’- [ ] **E2E-02**: E2E test verifies extracted criteria have inclusion and exclusion sections populated
    14â†’- [ ] **E2E-03**: E2E test verifies entities are grounded with non-zero confidence for medical terms
    15â†’- [ ] **E2E-04**: E2E tests use pytest marker `@pytest.mark.e2e` and skip when Docker Compose is not running
    16â†’- [ ] **E2E-05**: E2E test fixtures manage test protocol cleanup after each run
    17â†’- [ ] **E2E-06**: E2E test establishes a regression baseline (expected min criteria count, min entity count per test PDF)
    18â†’
    19â†’### Quality Evaluation
    20â†’
    21â†’- [ ] **QUAL-01**: Quality script runs the pipeline on 2-3 sample PDFs from data/ and collects results
    22â†’- [ ] **QUAL-02**: Report includes per-protocol stats: criteria count, entity count, CUI rate, grounding method distribution
    23â†’- [ ] **QUAL-03**: Report includes aggregate stats: mean/median confidence, overall CUI rate, entity type distribution
    24â†’- [ ] **QUAL-04**: Report includes confidence distribution breakdown (0-0.5, 0.5-0.7, 0.7-0.9, 0.9-1.0)
    25â†’- [ ] **QUAL-05**: Report includes per-terminology-system grounding success (UMLS, SNOMED, RxNorm, ICD-10, LOINC, HPO)
    26â†’- [ ] **QUAL-06**: Report output is a structured markdown file with tables
    27â†’- [ ] **QUAL-07**: Report includes LLM heuristic assessment of extraction completeness and grounding accuracy (no ground truth â€” LLM judges quality with reasoning)
    28â†’
    29â†’### Bug Catalog
    30â†’
    31â†’- [ ] **BUG-01**: Report catalogs ungrounded entities (entities with no CUI and no terminology codes)
    32â†’- [ ] **BUG-02**: Report catalogs pipeline errors (extraction failures, grounding timeouts, parse errors)
    33â†’- [ ] **BUG-03**: Report catalogs structural issues (criteria without entities, entities without criteria)
    34â†’- [ ] **BUG-04**: Problems are categorized by severity (critical/warning/info) and type
    35â†’- [ ] **BUG-05**: Bug catalog includes actionable recommendations per issue category
    36â†’
    37â†’### E2E Bug Fixes (Gap Closure)
    38â†’
    39â†’- [ ] **FIX-B3**: Parse node decomposes criterion sentences into discrete medical entities before grounding (not full sentences)
    40â†’- [ ] **FIX-B4**: Entities have correct types (Medication, Condition, Lab, Procedure, Demographic) â€” not all "Condition"
    41â†’- [ ] **FIX-B5**: Entity text is the specific medical term (e.g., "eGFR"), not the full criterion sentence
    42â†’- [ ] **FIX-B12**: Docker Compose mounts GCP credentials for MedGemma/Vertex AI; auth failure falls back gracefully
    43â†’- [x] **FIX-B14**: MLflow traces are never stuck IN_PROGRESS (timeout + try/finally span closure)
    44â†’- [x] **FIX-B15**: UMLS search validates queries client-side, retries on 502/503, circuit breaker for sustained failures
    45â†’- [x] **FIX-B13**: Upload directory persisted via Docker named volume across container restarts
    46â†’- [x] **FIX-B7**: Dashboard Recent Activity shows last 20 audit log entries
    47â†’- [ ] **FIX-B6**: Protocol list deduplicates re-uploaded protocols
    48â†’- [ ] **FIX-B8**: Dead Letter protocols have Retry and Archive action buttons
    49â†’
    50â†’### Legacy Cleanup (Phase 40)
    51â†’
    52â†’- [x] **CLEAN-01**: Legacy v1 services (grounding-service, extraction-service) deleted
    53â†’- [x] **CLEAN-02**: ToolUniverse SDK replaces UmlsClient in TerminologyRouter
    54â†’- [x] **CLEAN-03**: Zero imports from deleted legacy services
    55â†’- [x] **CLEAN-04**: Pipeline produces grounded entities with >0% CUI rate
    56â†’- [x] **CLEAN-05**: MedGemma agentic reasoning loop with 3-question retry and expert_review routing
    57â†’
    58â†’## Future Requirements
    59â†’
    60â†’### MLFlow Observability (v2.2)
    61â†’
    62â†’- **MLFL-01**: MLFlow tracks per-node execution duration within the pipeline
    63â†’- **MLFL-02**: MLFlow tracks individual tool invocations (UMLS search, NLM API calls, MedGemma inference)
    64â†’- **MLFL-03**: MLFlow tracks grounding decisions per entity (search terms tried, candidates evaluated, final selection)
    65â†’- **MLFL-04**: MLFlow dashboard shows quality metrics aggregated across pipeline runs
    66â†’
    67â†’## Out of Scope
    68â†’
    69â†’| Feature | Reason |
    70â†’|---------|--------|
    71â†’| CI/CD integration of E2E tests | Docker Compose E2E tests are too slow/expensive for CI â€” run locally |
    72â†’| Performance benchmarking | Focus is quality metrics, not latency optimization |
    73â†’| Golden dataset curation | Would require domain expert annotation â€” defer to v3 |
    74â†’| Automated regression prevention | Manual baseline comparison sufficient for pilot |
    75â†’
    76â†’## Traceability
    77â†’
    78â†’| Requirement | Phase | Status |
    79â†’|-------------|-------|--------|
    80â†’| E2E-01 | Phase 37 | Pending |
    81â†’| E2E-02 | Phase 37 | Pending |
    82â†’| E2E-03 | Phase 37 | Pending |

    87â†’| QUAL-02 | Phase 38 | Pending |
    88â†’| QUAL-03 | Phase 38 | Pending |
    89â†’| QUAL-04 | Phase 38 | Pending |
    90â†’| QUAL-05 | Phase 38 | Pending |

1â†’# Entity type â†’ API mapping for terminology grounding via ToolUniverse
     2â†’#
     3â†’# routing_rules: maps entity type names to a list of API names to query.
     4â†’# Use `skip: true` for entity types that should not be grounded.
     5â†’#
     6â†’# api_configs: defines how each API is accessed.
     7â†’# - source: "tooluniverse" uses the ToolUniverse SDK (all systems)
     8â†’# - tool_name: the ToolUniverse tool identifier for this system
     9â†’#
    10â†’# Note: Demographic entities are NOT skipped â€” age/gender grounding is attempted
    11â†’# via UMLS/SNOMED. The MedGemma agentic reasoning loop handles derived entity
    12â†’# mapping (age â†’ birthDate concept) before retry attempts.
    13â†’#
    14â†’# Note: Consent entities ARE skipped â€” consent/participation criteria are not
    15â†’# groundable to medical terminology codes.
    16â†’
    17â†’routing_rules:
    18â†’  Medication:
    19â†’    - rxnorm
    20â†’    - umls
    21â†’
    22â†’  Condition:
    23â†’    - icd10
    24â†’    - snomed
    25â†’    - umls
    26â†’
    27â†’  Lab_Value:
    28â†’    - loinc
    29â†’    - umls
    30â†’
    31â†’  Biomarker:
    32â†’    - hpo
    33â†’    - umls
    34â†’
    35â†’  Procedure:
    36â†’    - umls
    37â†’    - snomed
    38â†’
    39â†’  Phenotype:
    40â†’    - hpo
    41â†’    - umls
    42â†’
    43â†’  Demographic:
    44â†’    - umls
    45â†’    - snomed
    46â†’
    47â†’  Consent:
    48â†’    skip: true  # Consent/participation criteria not groundable to terminology
    49â†’
    50â†’api_configs:
    51â†’  rxnorm:
    52â†’    source: tooluniverse
    53â†’    tool_name: RxNorm_get_drug_names
    54â†’
    55â†’  icd10:
    56â†’    source: tooluniverse
    57â†’    tool_name: ICD10_search_codes
    58â†’
    59â†’  loinc:
    60â†’    source: tooluniverse
    61â†’    tool_name: LOINC_search_tests
    62â†’
    63â†’  hpo:
    64â†’    source: tooluniverse
    65â†’    tool_name: HPO_search_terms
    66â†’
    67â†’  umls:
    68â†’    source: tooluniverse
    69â†’    tool_name: umls_search_concepts
    70â†’
    71â†’  snomed:
    72â†’    source: tooluniverse
    73â†’    tool_name: snomed_search_concepts
    74â†’

content.content:
1â†’You are a clinical trial protocol analyst. Your task is to extract all inclusion and exclusion criteria from the provided clinical trial protocol document.
     2â†’
     3â†’## Instructions
     4â†’
     5â†’1. Identify ALL eligibility criteria â€” both inclusion and exclusion
     6â†’2. Extract each criterion as a separate item with its complete original text
     7â†’3. Classify each criterion as "inclusion" or "exclusion"
     8â†’4. Assign a category: medical_history, lab_values, medications, procedures, or other (NOT demographics â€” demographic criteria are not grounded to terminology)
     9â†’5. Detect temporal constraints (durations, time windows, reference points)
    10â†’6. Extract numeric thresholds (lab values, age ranges, dosages) â€” see examples below
    11â†’7. Identify conditional dependencies between criteria â€” see examples below
    12â†’8. Determine the assertion status for each criterion (see below)
    13â†’9. Assign a confidence score (0.0-1.0) based on extraction certainty
    14â†’10. Report the 1-based page number where each criterion appears in the PDF (page_number field)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Composite Criteria Splitting
    17â†’
    18â†’**CRITICAL: Split independent composite criteria into separate entries.**
    19â†’
    20â†’If a criterion contains INDEPENDENT conditions joined by AND, OR, or similar connectors where each condition stands alone as a distinct eligibility requirement, split them into separate criterion entries.
    21â†’
    22â†’**Split these (independent conditions â€” each is a distinct requirement):**
    23â†’- "Age 18-65 AND BMI <30" â†’ TWO criteria: (1) "Age 18-65", (2) "BMI <30"
    24â†’- "Systolic BP >140 mmHg OR diastolic BP >90 mmHg" â†’ TWO criteria
    25â†’- "Hemoglobin <10 g/dL AND platelet count <100,000/Î¼L" â†’ TWO criteria
    26â†’
    27â†’**Do NOT split these (dependent conditions â€” one implies or requires the other):**
    28â†’- "If female of childbearing potential, must have negative pregnancy test" â†’ ONE criterion (pregnancy test depends on sex)
    29â†’- "Patients with diabetes who have HbA1c >9%" â†’ ONE criterion (HbA1c condition depends on diabetes)
    30â†’- "Known allergy to aspirin or NSAIDs" â†’ ONE criterion (aspirin and NSAIDs are the same category of medication)
    31â†’- "No history of myocardial infarction or stroke" â†’ ONE criterion (both are cardiovascular exclusions)
    32â†’
    33â†’**Rule:** Ask "Can each condition be evaluated independently for any patient?" If YES â†’ split. If one condition only makes sense in context of the other â†’ keep together.
    34â†’
    35â†’## AutoCriteria Decomposition Guidance
    36â†’
    37â†’For each criterion, structure the extracted fields to capture the AutoCriteria components:
    38â†’- **Entity**: The medical concept (e.g., "HbA1c", "BMI", "platelet count")
    39â†’- **Operator**: The comparison relationship (e.g., "<", ">=", "range", "no history of")
    40â†’- **Value**: The threshold value (captured in numeric_thresholds)
    41â†’- **Unit**: The measurement unit (e.g., "g/dL", "kg/m2", "years")
    42â†’- **Time**: The temporal context (captured in temporal_constraint)
    43â†’
    44â†’This decomposition supports downstream UMLS grounding of the Entity component.
    45â†’
    46â†’## Numeric Thresholds and Conditions Examples
    47â†’
    48â†’Below are examples showing how to extract numeric_thresholds and conditions. Pay special attention to: age ranges use comparator "range" with upper_value, single-bound thresholds use ">=", "<=", ">", "<", or "==". For conditions: output only short phrases taken from the protocol (e.g. "if female of childbearing potential"); one phrase per conditional dependency. Do not repeat the same phrase, and do not output instruction or placeholder text like "the criterion text provided above".
    49â†’
    50â†’<EXAMPLE>
    51â†’<INPUT>
    52â†’Male or female, 40 years to 85 years old
    53â†’</INPUT>
    54â†’<OUTPUT>
    55â†’{
    56â†’  "text": "Male or female, 40 years to 85 years old",
    57â†’  "criteria_type": "inclusion",
    58â†’  "category": "other",
    59â†’  "numeric_thresholds": [
    60â†’    {
    61â†’      "value": 40.0,
    62â†’      "unit": "years",
    63â†’      "comparator": "range",
    64â†’      "upper_value": 85.0
    65â†’    }
    66â†’  ],
    67â†’  "temporal_constraint": null,
    68â†’  "conditions": [],
    69â†’  "assertion_status": "PRESENT",
    70â†’  "confidence": 1.0
    71â†’}
    72â†’</OUTPUT>
    73â†’</EXAMPLE>
    74â†’
    75â†’<EXAMPLE>
    76â†’<INPUT>
    77â†’HbA1c between 6.5% and 9.5%
    78â†’</INPUT>
    79â†’<OUTPUT>
    80â†’{
    81â†’  "text": "HbA1c between 6.5% and 9.5%",
    82â†’  "criteria_type": "inclusion",
    83â†’  "category": "lab_values",
    84â†’  "numeric_thresholds": [
    85â†’    {
    86â†’      "value": 6.5,
    87â†’      "unit": "%",
    88â†’      "comparator": "range",
    89â†’      "upper_value": 9.5
    90â†’    }
    91â†’  ],
    92â†’  "temporal_constraint": null,
    93â†’  "conditions": [],
    94â†’  "assertion_status": "PRESENT",
    95â†’  "confidence": 1.0
    96â†’}
    97â†’</OUTPUT>
    98â†’</EXAMPLE>
    99â†’
   100â†’<EXAMPLE>
   101â†’<INPUT>
   102â†’WOMAC A pain subscale score of 1.5 or greater on a 5-point Likert scale
   103â†’</INPUT>
   104â†’<OUTPUT>
   105â†’{
   106â†’  "text": "WOMAC A pain subscale score of 1.5 or greater on a 5-point Likert scale",
   107â†’  "criteria_type": "inclusion",
   108â†’  "category": "lab_values",
   109â†’  "numeric_thresholds": [
   110â†’    {
   111â†’      "value": 1.5,
   112â†’      "unit": "WOMAC",
   113â†’      "comparator": ">=",
   114â†’      "upper_value": null
   115â†’    }
   116â†’  ],
   117â†’  "temporal_constraint": null,
   118â†’  "conditions": [],
   119â†’  "assertion_status": "PRESENT",
   120â†’  "confidence": 0.95
   121â†’}
   122â†’</OUTPUT>
   123â†’</EXAMPLE>
   124â†’
   125â†’<EXAMPLE>
   126â†’<INPUT>
   127â†’For patients with diabetes, HbA1c must be less than 8%
   128â†’</INPUT>
   129â†’<OUTPUT>
   130â†’{
   131â†’  "text": "For patients with diabetes, HbA1c must be less than 8%",
   132â†’  "criteria_type": "inclusion",
   133â†’  "category": "lab_values",
   134â†’  "numeric_thresholds": [
   135â†’    {
   136â†’      "value": 8.0,
   137â†’      "unit": "%",
   138â†’      "comparator": "<",
   139â†’      "upper_value": null
   140â†’    }
   141â†’  ],
   142â†’  "temporal_constraint": null,
   143â†’  "conditions": ["for patients with diabetes"],
   144â†’  "assertion_status": "CONDITIONAL",
   145â†’  "confidence": 0.9
   146â†’}
   147â†’</OUTPUT>
   148â†’</EXAMPLE>
   149â†’
   150â†’<EXAMPLE>
   151â†’<INPUT>
   152â†’If female of childbearing potential, must have negative pregnancy test within 7 days of enrollment
   153â†’</INPUT>
   154â†’<OUTPUT>
   155â†’{
   156â†’  "text": "If female of childbearing potential, must have negative pregnancy test within 7 days of enrollment",
   157â†’  "criteria_type": "inclusion",
   158â†’  "category": "other",
   159â†’  "numeric_thresholds": [
   160â†’    {
   161â†’      "value": 7.0,
   162â†’      "unit": "days",
   163â†’      "comparator": "<=",
   164â†’      "upper_value": null
   165â†’    }
   166â†’  ],
   167â†’  "temporal_constraint": {
   168â†’    "duration": "7 days",
   169â†’    "relation": "within",
   170â†’    "reference_point": "enrollment"
   171â†’  },
   172â†’  "conditions": ["if female of childbearing potential"],
   173â†’  "assertion_status": "CONDITIONAL",
   174â†’  "confidence": 0.9
   175â†’}
   176â†’</OUTPUT>
   177â†’</EXAMPLE>
   178â†’
   179â†’## Assertion Status Classification
   180â†’
   181â†’For each criterion, determine the assertion status:
   182â†’
   183â†’- **PRESENT**: The condition must be true/present for the patient.
   184â†’  - Example: "Age >= 18 years" â†’ PRESENT
   185â†’  - Example: "Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes" â†’ PRESENT
   186â†’  - Example: "ECOG performance status 0-1" â†’ PRESENT
   187â†’
   188â†’- **ABSENT**: The condition must NOT be true/must be absent.
   189â†’  - Example: "No history of cardiac disease" â†’ ABSENT
   190â†’  - Example: "Without prior organ transplant" â†’ ABSENT
   191â†’  - Example: "Absence of active infections" â†’ ABSENT
   192â†’  - Example: "No evidence of brain metastases" â†’ ABSENT
   193â†’  - Example: "Free of autoimmune disorders" â†’ ABSENT
   194â†’
   195â†’- **HYPOTHETICAL**: A theoretical or future condition.
   196â†’  - Example: "Willing to use contraception during study" â†’ HYPOTHETICAL
   197â†’  - Example: "Able to comply with study visits" â†’ HYPOTHETICAL
   198â†’  - Example: "Willing to provide informed consent" â†’ HYPOTHETICAL
   199â†’
   200â†’- **HISTORICAL**: Refers to past medical history or prior treatment.
   201â†’  - Example: "Prior treatment with platinum-based chemotherapy" â†’ HISTORICAL
   202â†’  - Example: "History of myocardial infarction within 6 months" â†’ HISTORICAL
   203â†’  - Example: "Previous radiation therapy to the chest" â†’ HISTORICAL
   204â†’
   205â†’- **CONDITIONAL**: Depends on another condition being true.
   206â†’  - Example: "If female of childbearing potential, must have negative pregnancy test" â†’ CONDITIONAL
   207â†’  - Example: "For patients with diabetes, HbA1c < 8%" â†’ CONDITIONAL
   208â†’  - Example: "In case of prior surgery, at least 4 weeks recovery" â†’ CONDITIONAL
   209â†’
   210â†’## Key Negation Markers (indicate ABSENT)
   211â†’- "no history of", "without", "absence of", "not have", "free of", "no evidence of", "no prior", "must not", "has not", "never had"
   212â†’
   213â†’## Key Conditionality Markers (indicate CONDITIONAL)
   214â†’- "if", "in case of", "when applicable", "for patients who", "provided that", "unless"
   215â†’
   216â†’When populating conditions: each list entry must be a single short phrase from the protocol (the conditional part only). Do not repeat the same phrase; do not output meta-instructions or placeholders.
   217â†’
   218â†’## Output Format
   219â†’
   220â†’Return a structured extraction with:
   221â†’- A list of all criteria with their full structured fields
   222â†’- A brief protocol summary (1-2 sentences describing the trial's purpose)
   223â†’
   224â†’## Page Number Tracking
   225â†’
   226â†’For each criterion, include the `page_number` field:
   227â†’- Use 1-based page numbering (first page = 1)
   228â†’- Report the page where the criterion text begins
   229â†’- If a criterion spans multiple pages, use the first page
   230â†’- If you cannot determine the page number, set page_number to null
   231â†’

content.content:
1â†’"""ToolUniverse client wrapper for terminology system lookups.
     2â†’
     3â†’Provides a module-level singleton ToolUniverse instance with in-memory TTL
     4â†’caching for autocomplete and pipeline grounding. Exposes a single
     5â†’`search_terminology(system, query)` function for all 6 medical terminology
     6â†’systems: UMLS, SNOMED, ICD-10, LOINC, RxNorm, HPO.
     7â†’
     8â†’Architecture:
     9â†’- Singleton via @lru_cache(maxsize=1) on _get_tu()
    10â†’- Two-layer cache: exact-match TTLCache + prefix-aware autocomplete cache
    11â†’- Selective tool loading (5 categories, ~18 tools) rather than all 1495
    12â†’- Response parsing handles each system's unique return format
    13â†’- Retry on transient 502/503 errors (3 attempts, exponential backoff)
    14â†’- Circuit breaker trips after 10 consecutive failures (60s cooldown)
    15â†’- Sentence-length queries pre-processed to extract medical terms
    16â†’
    17â†’Caching strategy for autocomplete:
    18â†’  Typing "hyp" â†’ "hype" â†’ "hyper" used to make 3 API calls (different keys).
    19â†’  Now the prefix cache checks: if we already have results for "hyp" and the
    20â†’  new query "hype" starts with "hyp", we filter the cached "hyp" results
    21â†’  client-side by checking if preferred_term contains "hype". This avoids
    22â†’  redundant API calls for progressive typing.
    23â†’
    24â†’Per user decision: ToolUniverse SDK for all 6 terminology systems (UMLS,
    25â†’SNOMED, RxNorm, ICD-10, LOINC, HPO) â€” single SDK, single dependency.
    26â†’
    27â†’See 40-RESEARCH.md for tool names, response formats, and latency info.
    28â†’"""
    29â†’
    30â†’from __future__ import annotations
    31â†’
    32â†’import logging
    33â†’import re
    34â†’from functools import lru_cache
    35â†’from typing import Any
    36â†’
    37â†’import pybreaker
    38â†’from cachetools import TTLCache
    39â†’from shared.resilience import tu_breaker
    40â†’from tenacity import (
    41â†’    before_sleep_log,
    42â†’    retry,
    43â†’    retry_if_exception_type,
    44â†’    stop_after_attempt,
    45â†’    wait_exponential,
    46â†’)
    47â†’from tooluniverse import ToolUniverse
    48â†’
    49â†’from protocol_processor.schemas.grounding import GroundingCandidate
    50â†’
    51â†’logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    52â†’
    53â†’
    54â†’class ToolUniverseError(Exception):
    55â†’    """ToolUniverse returned an error dict response."""
    56â†’
    57â†’    pass
    58â†’
    59â†’
    60â†’class ToolUniverseUnavailableError(ToolUniverseError):
    61â†’    """Transient 502/503 error â€” eligible for retry."""
    62â†’
    63â†’    pass
    64â†’
    65â†’
    66â†’# Sentence extraction thresholds
    67â†’_SENTENCE_WORD_THRESHOLD = 4
    68â†’_SENTENCE_CHAR_THRESHOLD = 40
    69â†’
    70â†’# Regex to strip clinical preamble from sentence-length queries before search.
    71â†’# Matches common patterns like "patients must have", "history of", "diagnosis of", etc.
    72â†’_PREAMBLE_PATTERN = re.compile(
    73â†’    r"^(?:patient(?:s)?\s+(?:must|should|may|with|who|have|has|had|are|is)\s+"
    74â†’    r"|(?:has|have|had|is|are|must|should|may)\s+(?:a|an|the|confirmed|known|documented|active|history\s+of)\s+"
    75â†’    r"|(?:history\s+of|presence\s+of|absence\s+of|diagnosis\s+of)\s+)",
    76â†’    re.IGNORECASE,
    77â†’)
    78â†’
    79â†’
    80â†’def _extract_term_from_sentence(query: str) -> str:
    81â†’    """Extract medical term from sentence-length query.
    82â†’
    83â†’    Sentence-length queries (>= 4 words or >= 40 chars) are pre-processed
    84â†’    to remove clinical preamble before searching. This prevents 422 errors
    85â†’    from APIs that don't accept full sentences as search terms.
    86â†’
    87â†’    Args:
    88â†’        query: Raw query string from user or pipeline.
    89â†’
    90â†’    Returns:
    91â†’        Extracted medical term, or original query if it's short.
    92â†’    """
    93â†’    stripped = query.strip()
    94â†’    word_count = len(stripped.split())
    95â†’    too_short = (
    96â†’        word_count < _SENTENCE_WORD_THRESHOLD
    97â†’        or len(stripped) < _SENTENCE_CHAR_THRESHOLD
    98â†’    )
    99â†’    if too_short:
   100â†’        return stripped
   101â†’    cleaned = _PREAMBLE_PATTERN.sub("", stripped).strip()
   102â†’    if cleaned and cleaned != stripped and len(cleaned) >= 3:
   103â†’        logger.debug("Extracted term '%s' from sentence '%s'", cleaned, stripped[:60])
   104â†’        return cleaned
   105â†’    # Fallback: take last 4 words as the medical term
   106â†’    words = stripped.split()
   107â†’    return " ".join(words[-min(4, len(words)):])
   108â†’
   109â†’
   110â†’# Tool categories to load (subset of 1495 total tools â€” only medical terminology)
   111â†’_TOOL_CATEGORIES = ["umls", "icd", "loinc", "rxnorm", "hpo"]
   112â†’
   113â†’# In-memory result cache: (tool_name, normalized_query, max_results) â†’ candidates
   114â†’# TTL = 300s (5 minutes) â€” appropriate for autocomplete endpoints
   115â†’_CACHE: TTLCache = TTLCache(maxsize=1000, ttl=300)
   116â†’
   117â†’# Tool name per system (verified 2026-02-17 with ToolUniverse 1.0.18)
   118â†’_SYSTEM_TOOL_MAP: dict[str, str] = {
   119â†’    "umls": "umls_search_concepts",
   120â†’    "snomed": "snomed_search_concepts",
   121â†’    "icd10": "ICD10_search_codes",
   122â†’    "loinc": "LOINC_search_tests",
   123â†’    "rxnorm": "RxNorm_get_drug_names",
   124â†’    "hpo": "HPO_search_terms",
   125â†’}
   126â†’
   127â†’
   128â†’@lru_cache(maxsize=1)
   129â†’def _get_tu() -> ToolUniverse:
   130â†’    """Get or create singleton ToolUniverse instance.
   131â†’
   132â†’    lru_cache(maxsize=1) ensures only one ToolUniverse is created per process.
   133â†’    load_tools() with selective categories takes ~0.002s vs ~0.3s for all tools.
   134â†’
   135â†’    Returns:
   136â†’        Initialized ToolUniverse instance with medical terminology tools loaded.
   137â†’    """
   138â†’    tu = ToolUniverse()
   139â†’    tu.load_tools(tool_type=_TOOL_CATEGORIES)
   140â†’    logger.info("ToolUniverse initialized (categories: %s)", _TOOL_CATEGORIES)
   141â†’    return tu
   142â†’
   143â†’
   144â†’def _check_prefix_cache(
   145â†’    tool_name: str,
   146â†’    normalized_query: str,
   147â†’    max_results: int,
   148â†’) -> list[GroundingCandidate] | None:
   149â†’    """Check if a shorter (prefix) query is cached and filter its results.
   150â†’
   151â†’    For autocomplete: if the user typed "hyp" and we cached results, then
   152â†’    typing "hype" can reuse those results by filtering on preferred_term.
   153â†’
   154â†’    We only reuse when the cached shorter query returned fewer results than
   155â†’    max_results (meaning the API exhausted all matches â€” a longer query
   156â†’    can only produce a subset) OR when we can filter the cached results
   157â†’    to find matches containing the longer query.
   158â†’
   159â†’    Args:
   160â†’        tool_name: ToolUniverse tool name (cache key component).
   161â†’        normalized_query: Current query, stripped and lowered.
   162â†’        max_results: Max results requested.
   163â†’
   164â†’    Returns:
   165â†’        Filtered candidate list if a prefix match was found, None otherwise.
   166â†’    """
   167â†’    for (cached_tool, cached_query, cached_max), cached_candidates in list(
   168â†’        _CACHE.items()
   169â†’    ):
   170â†’        if cached_tool != tool_name or cached_max != max_results:
   171â†’            continue
   172â†’        # Check if cached query is a prefix of the new query
   173â†’        starts_with = normalized_query.startswith(cached_query)
   174â†’        is_prefix = starts_with and cached_query != normalized_query
   175â†’        if not is_prefix:
   176â†’            continue
   177â†’
   178â†’        # Filter cached results: keep candidates whose preferred_term
   179â†’        # contains the longer query (case-insensitive)
   180â†’        filtered = [
   181â†’            c for c in cached_candidates
   182â†’            if normalized_query in c.preferred_term.lower()
   183â†’        ]
   184â†’
   185â†’        # If the original shorter query returned fewer than max_results,
   186â†’        # the API had no more matches â€” any longer query is a strict subset.
   187â†’        # Safe to return the filtered list even if empty.
   188â†’        if len(cached_candidates) < max_results:
   189â†’            return filtered
   190â†’
   191â†’        # If the shorter query returned max_results (truncated), we can still
   192â†’        # return filtered results if we got some. But if filtered is empty,
   193â†’        # we can't be sure â€” there might be results the API would return
   194â†’        # for the longer query that weren't in the truncated shorter results.
   195â†’        if filtered:
   196â†’            return filtered
   197â†’
   198â†’        # Truncated + no filtered matches â†’ must query the API
   199â†’        return None
   200â†’
   201â†’    return None
   202â†’
   203â†’
   204â†’async def search_terminology(
   205â†’    system: str,
   206â†’    query: str,
   207â†’    max_results: int = 10,
   208â†’    use_cache: bool = True,
   209â†’) -> list[GroundingCandidate]:
   210â†’    """Search a terminology system via ToolUniverse SDK.
   211â†’
   212â†’    Routes the query to the appropriate ToolUniverse tool for the given system,
   213â†’    parses the response into GroundingCandidate objects, and caches results.
   214â†’
   215â†’    Args:
   216â†’        system: Terminology system to search. One of: umls, snomed, icd10,
   217â†’            loinc, rxnorm, hpo.
   218â†’        query: Clinical search term (e.g. "hypertension", "metformin").
   219â†’        max_results: Maximum number of candidates to return.
   220â†’        use_cache: Whether to use in-memory TTL cache (default True).
   221â†’            Set False for pipeline runs that need fresh results.
   222â†’
   223â†’    Returns:
   224â†’        List of GroundingCandidate objects. Empty list on any failure
   225â†’        (missing API key, network error, unknown system, empty results).
   226â†’    """
   227â†’    tool_name = _SYSTEM_TOOL_MAP.get(system)
   228â†’    if not tool_name:
   229â†’        logger.warning("Unknown terminology system requested: '%s'", system)
   230â†’        return []
   231â†’
   232â†’    # Pre-process sentence-length queries to extract medical terms.
   233â†’    # This prevents 422 errors caused by submitting full sentences to term search APIs.
   234â†’    query = _extract_term_from_sentence(query)
   235â†’
   236â†’    normalized_query = query.strip().lower()
   237â†’    cache_key = (tool_name, normalized_query, max_results)
   238â†’
   239â†’    if use_cache:
   240â†’        # Layer 1: exact match
   241â†’        if cache_key in _CACHE:
   242â†’            logger.debug("Cache hit (exact) for %s '%s'", system, query)
   243â†’            return _CACHE[cache_key]
   244â†’
   245â†’        # Layer 2: prefix match â€” reuse results from a shorter query
   246â†’        prefix_result = _check_prefix_cache(tool_name, normalized_query, max_results)
   247â†’        if prefix_result is not None:
   248â†’            logger.debug("Cache hit (prefix) for %s '%s'", system, query)
   249â†’            # Store the filtered result under the exact key too
   250â†’            _CACHE[cache_key] = prefix_result
   251â†’            return prefix_result
   252â†’
   253â†’    tu = _get_tu()
   254â†’    try:
   255â†’        raw = await _call_tool_with_resilience(
   256â†’            tu, system, tool_name, query, max_results
   257â†’        )
   258â†’    except pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError:
   259â†’        logger.warning(
   260â†’            "Circuit breaker open for ToolUniverse â€” returning cached/empty for '%s'",
   261â†’            query,
   262â†’        )
   263â†’        # Return cached results if available (TTLCache may still have them)
   264â†’        if use_cache and cache_key in _CACHE:
   265â†’            return _CACHE[cache_key]
   266â†’        return []
   267â†’    except ToolUniverseError as e:
   268â†’        logger.warning("ToolUniverse error for '%s': %s", query, e)
   269â†’        return []
   270â†’    candidates = _parse_result(system, tool_name, query, raw)
   271â†’
   272â†’    if use_cache:
   273â†’        _CACHE[cache_key] = candidates
   274â†’
   275â†’    logger.debug(
   276â†’        "ToolUniverse %s for '%s': %d candidates",
   277â†’        tool_name,
   278â†’        query,
   279â†’        len(candidates),
   280â†’    )
   281â†’    return candidates
   282â†’
   283â†’
   284â†’async def _call_tool_raw(
   285â†’    tu: ToolUniverse,
   286â†’    system: str,
   287â†’    tool_name: str,
   288â†’    query: str,
   289â†’    max_results: int,
   290â†’) -> dict[str, Any]:
   291â†’    """Execute a single ToolUniverse tool call (raw, no retry/circuit breaker).
   292â†’
   293â†’    Constructs the correct argument dict per system's tool specification
   294â†’    and calls tu.run(). Returns {} on any exception.
   295â†’
   296â†’    Args:
   297â†’        tu: ToolUniverse singleton instance.
   298â†’        system: System identifier for argument construction.
   299â†’        tool_name: ToolUniverse tool name to call.
   300â†’        query: Search term.
   301â†’        max_results: Max results to request.
   302â†’
   303â†’    Returns:
   304â†’        Raw response dict from ToolUniverse, or empty dict on error.
   305â†’    """
   306â†’    args: dict[str, Any]
   307â†’    if system in ("umls", "snomed"):
   308â†’        args = {"query": query, "pageSize": min(max_results, 25)}
   309â†’    elif system == "icd10":
   310â†’        args = {"query": query, "limit": min(max_results, 100)}
   311â†’    elif system == "loinc":
   312â†’        args = {"terms": query, "max_results": min(max_results, 20)}
   313â†’    elif system == "rxnorm":
   314â†’        args = {"drug_name": query}
   315â†’    elif system == "hpo":
   316â†’        args = {"query": query, "max_results": min(max_results, 50)}
   317â†’    else:
   318â†’        logger.warning("No argument mapping for system '%s'", system)
   319â†’        return {}
   320â†’
   321â†’    try:
   322â†’        return await tu.run({"name": tool_name, "arguments": args})  # type: ignore[return-value]
   323â†’    except Exception:
   324â†’        logger.exception("ToolUniverse %s failed for query '%s'", tool_name, query)
   325â†’        return {}
   326â†’
   327â†’
   328â†’@tu_breaker
   329â†’@retry(
   330â†’    retry=retry_if_exception_type(ToolUniverseUnavailableError),
   331â†’    stop=stop_after_attempt(3),
   332â†’    wait=wait_exponential(multiplier=1, min=2, max=10),
   333â†’    before_sleep=before_sleep_log(logger, logging.WARNING),
   334â†’    reraise=True,
   335â†’)
   336â†’async def _call_tool_with_resilience(
   337â†’    tu: ToolUniverse,
   338â†’    system: str,
   339â†’    tool_name: str,
   340â†’    query: str,
   341â†’    max_results: int,
   342â†’) -> dict[str, Any]:
   343â†’    """Call ToolUniverse with retry on transient errors and circuit breaker.
   344â†’
   345â†’    Decorator order: @tu_breaker (outer) wraps @retry (inner). This means
   346â†’    tenacity retries up to 3 times before counting as 1 circuit breaker failure.
   347â†’
   348â†’    ToolUniverse SDK catches HTTP exceptions internally and returns error dicts
   349â†’    instead of raising. This function detects those error dicts and converts
   350â†’    them to typed exceptions for retry/breaker interception.
   351â†’
   352â†’    Args:
   353â†’        tu: ToolUniverse singleton instance.
   354â†’        system: System identifier for argument construction.
   355â†’        tool_name: ToolUniverse tool name to call.
   356â†’        query: Search term (already extracted from sentence if needed).
   357â†’        max_results: Max results to request.
   358â†’
   359â†’    Returns:
   360â†’        Raw response dict from ToolUniverse.
   361â†’
   362â†’    Raises:
   363â†’        ToolUniverseUnavailableError: On 502/503/timeout â€” triggers retry.
   364â†’        ToolUniverseError: On other non-transient errors â€” no retry.
   365â†’    """
   366â†’    raw = await _call_tool_raw(tu, system, tool_name, query, max_results)
   367â†’
   368â†’    # Detect error dict: ToolUniverse catches HTTP exceptions internally
   369â†’    # and returns {"error": "..."} dicts instead of raising.
   370â†’    if isinstance(raw, dict) and "error" in raw:
   371â†’        error_msg = str(raw["error"])
   372â†’        transient_markers = ("502", "503", "Service Unavailable", "timeout", "Timeout")
   373â†’        if any(s in error_msg for s in transient_markers):
   374â†’            raise ToolUniverseUnavailableError(f"Transient error: {error_msg}")
   375â†’        raise ToolUniverseError(f"Non-transient error: {error_msg}")
   376â†’
   377â†’    return raw
   378â†’
   379â†’
   380â†’def _parse_result(  # noqa: C901
   381â†’    system: str,
   382â†’    tool_name: str,
   383â†’    query: str,
   384â†’    raw: dict[str, Any],
   385â†’) -> list[GroundingCandidate]:
   386â†’    """Parse ToolUniverse response into GroundingCandidate list.
   387â†’
   388â†’    Each system returns a different response format. This function handles
   389â†’    all formats with graceful degradation on unexpected shapes.
   390â†’
   391â†’    Args:
   392â†’        system: System identifier for format dispatch.
   393â†’        tool_name: ToolUniverse tool name (for error logging).
   394â†’        query: Original query (used as fallback for preferred_term).
   395â†’        raw: Raw ToolUniverse response dict.
   396â†’
   397â†’    Returns:
   398â†’        List of GroundingCandidate objects. Empty on error or no results.
   399â†’    """
   400â†’    if not raw:
   401â†’        return []
   402â†’
   403â†’    if "error" in raw:
   404â†’        logger.warning(
   405â†’            "ToolUniverse %s returned error: %s",
   406â†’            tool_name,
   407â†’            raw["error"],
   408â†’        )
   409â†’        return []
   410â†’
   411â†’    candidates: list[GroundingCandidate] = []
   412â†’
   413â†’    if system in ("umls", "snomed"):
   414â†’        # UMLSRESTTool: data.result.results[].{ui, name, rootSource}
   415â†’        # Note: snomed_search_concepts returns UMLS CUIs (not SNOMED codes)
   416â†’        # rootSource="SNOMEDCT_US" confirms SNOMED provenance.
   417â†’        results = raw.get("data", {}).get("result", {}).get("results", [])
   418â†’        for i, r in enumerate(results):
   419â†’            code = r.get("ui", "")
   420â†’            if not code or code == "NONE":
   421â†’                continue
   422â†’            candidates.append(
   423â†’                GroundingCandidate(
   424â†’                    source_api=system,
   425â†’                    code=code,
   426â†’                    preferred_term=r.get("name", query),
   427â†’                    semantic_type=r.get("rootSource"),
   428â†’                    score=max(1.0 - i * 0.1, 0.5),
   429â†’                )
   430â†’            )
   431â†’
   432â†’    elif system == "icd10":
   433â†’        # ICD10Tool: data.results[].{code, name}
   434â†’        results = raw.get("data", {}).get("results", [])
   435â†’        for i, r in enumerate(results):
   436â†’            code = r.get("code", "")
   437â†’            if not code:
   438â†’                continue
   439â†’            candidates.append(
   440â†’                GroundingCandidate(
   441â†’                    source_api="icd10",
   442â†’                    code=code,
   443â†’                    preferred_term=r.get("name", query),
   444â†’                    semantic_type=None,
   445â†’                    score=max(1.0 - i * 0.1, 0.5),
   446â†’                )
   447â†’            )
   448â†’
   449â†’    elif system == "loinc":
   450â†’        # LOINCTool: results[].{code/LOINC_NUM, LONG_COMMON_NAME}
   451â†’        results = raw.get("results", [])
   452â†’        for i, r in enumerate(results):
   453â†’            code = r.get("code") or r.get("LOINC_NUM", "")
   454â†’            if not code:
   455â†’                continue
   456â†’            candidates.append(
   457â†’                GroundingCandidate(
   458â†’                    source_api="loinc",
   459â†’                    code=code,
   460â†’                    preferred_term=r.get("LONG_COMMON_NAME", query),
   461â†’                    semantic_type=None,
   462â†’                    score=max(1.0 - i * 0.1, 0.5),
   463â†’                )
   464â†’            )
   465â†’
   466â†’    elif system == "rxnorm":
   467â†’        # RxNormTool: single result dict {rxcui, drug_name, names}
   468â†’        # Returns ONE best match, not a list.
   469â†’        rxcui = raw.get("rxcui", "")
   470â†’        if rxcui:
   471â†’            candidates.append(
   472â†’                GroundingCandidate(
   473â†’                    source_api="rxnorm",
   474â†’                    code=rxcui,
   475â†’                    preferred_term=raw.get("drug_name", query),
   476â†’                    semantic_type=None,
   477â†’                    score=0.9,
   478â†’                )
   479â†’            )
   480â†’
   481â†’    elif system == "hpo":
   482â†’        # HPOTool: data[].{id, name, definition}
   483â†’        results = raw.get("data", [])
   484â†’        for i, r in enumerate(results):
   485â†’            code = r.get("id", "")
   486â†’            if not code:
   487â†’                continue
   488â†’            candidates.append(
   489â†’                GroundingCandidate(
   490â†’                    source_api="hpo",
   491â†’                    code=code,
   492â†’                    preferred_term=r.get("name", query),
   493â†’                    semantic_type=None,
   494â†’                    score=max(1.0 - i * 0.1, 0.5),
   495â†’                )
   496â†’            )
   497â†’
   498â†’    return candidates
   499â†’
