content.content:
1â†’"""Unified outbox event handler for ProtocolUploaded events.
     2â†’
     3â†’Replaces the two-service trigger pattern (extraction_service + grounding_service)
     4â†’with a single consolidated handler that invokes the full 5-node pipeline:
     5â†’ingest -> extract -> parse -> ground -> persist
     6â†’
     7â†’Per user decision (v2.0): "Remove criteria_extracted outbox, retain protocol_uploaded"
     8â†’
     9â†’The handler is synchronous (called by OutboxProcessor.poll_and_process) and
    10â†’bridges to the async graph via asyncio.run(). This works without event loop
    11â†’conflicts because the outbox processor runs handlers in a thread executor
    12â†’via run_in_executor, so there is no existing event loop in the current thread.
    13â†’
    14â†’Checkpointing: Each invocation generates a unique thread_id (protocol_id:uuid4)
    15â†’and stores it in protocol.metadata_ so that retry_from_checkpoint can look it up.
    16â†’This prevents checkpoint collision when re-extracting the same protocol.
    17â†’"""
    18â†’
    19â†’from __future__ import annotations
    20â†’
    21â†’import asyncio
    22â†’import logging
    23â†’import os
    24â†’from typing import Any
    25â†’from uuid import uuid4
    26â†’
    27â†’from api_service.storage import engine
    28â†’from shared.models import Protocol
    29â†’from sqlmodel import Session
    30â†’
    31â†’logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    32â†’
    33â†’
    34â†’def _ensure_mlflow() -> bool:
    35â†’    """Ensure MLflow tracking is configured in the current thread.
    36â†’
    37â†’    Returns True if MLflow tracing is available and configured.
    38â†’    """
    39â†’    try:
    40â†’        import mlflow
    41â†’
    42â†’        tracking_uri = os.getenv("MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI")
    43â†’        if tracking_uri:
    44â†’            mlflow.set_tracking_uri(tracking_uri)
    45â†’            mlflow.set_experiment("protocol-processing")
    46â†’            return True
    47â†’    except ImportError:
    48â†’        pass
    49â†’    return False
    50â†’
    51â†’
    52â†’def _categorize_pipeline_error(e: Exception) -> str:
    53â†’    """Convert exception to human-readable pipeline error reason.
    54â†’
    55â†’    Combines extraction and grounding error categorization from both
    56â†’    the old extraction_service and grounding_service triggers.
    57â†’
    58â†’    Args:
    59â†’        e: The exception that occurred during pipeline execution.
    60â†’
    61â†’    Returns:
    62â†’        Human-readable error message for the user.
    63â†’    """
    64â†’    error_str = str(e).lower()
    65â†’
    66â†’    # PDF / extraction errors
    67â†’    if "pdf" in error_str or "pymupdf" in error_str:
    68â†’        return "PDF text quality too low or file corrupted"
    69â†’    if "gcs" in error_str or "storage" in error_str or "bucket" in error_str:
    70â†’        return "File storage service unavailable"
    71â†’
    72â†’    # Auth / credential errors
    73â†’    if "credential" in error_str or "auth" in error_str:
    74â†’        return "Service authentication failed"
    75â†’
    76â†’    # UMLS / grounding errors
    77â†’    if "mcp" in error_str or "subprocess" in error_str:
    78â†’        return "UMLS grounding service unavailable"
    79â†’    if "concept_linking" in error_str or "concept_search" in error_str:
    80â†’        return "UMLS terminology service unavailable"
    81â†’
    82â†’    # Generic transient errors
    83â†’    if "circuit" in error_str:
    84â†’        return "AI service temporarily unavailable"
    85â†’    if "timeout" in error_str or "timed out" in error_str:
    86â†’        return "Processing timed out"
    87â†’    if "parse" in error_str:
    88â†’        return "Protocol parsing failed"
    89â†’
    90â†’    return f"Pipeline failed: {type(e).__name__}"
    91â†’
    92â†’
    93â†’def _update_protocol_failed(
    94â†’    protocol_id: str,
    95â†’    reason: str,
    96â†’    error_category: str,
    97â†’    exception_type: str,
    98â†’) -> None:
    99â†’    """Update protocol status to pipeline_failed with error metadata.
   100â†’
   101â†’    Args:
   102â†’        protocol_id: Protocol ID to update.
   103â†’        reason: Human-readable error reason.
   104â†’        error_category: Short category string for the error type.
   105â†’        exception_type: Python exception class name.
   106â†’    """
   107â†’    try:
   108â†’        with Session(engine) as session:
   109â†’            protocol = session.get(Protocol, protocol_id)
   110â†’            if protocol:
   111â†’                protocol.status = "extraction_failed"
   112â†’                protocol.error_reason = reason
   113â†’                protocol.metadata_ = {
   114â†’                    **protocol.metadata_,
   115â†’                    "error": {
   116â†’                        "category": error_category,
   117â†’                        "reason": reason,
   118â†’                        "exception_type": exception_type,
   119â†’                    },
   120â†’                }
   121â†’                session.add(protocol)
   122â†’                session.commit()
   123â†’    except Exception:
   124â†’        logger.exception(
   125â†’            "Failed to update protocol %s status to extraction_failed",
   126â†’            protocol_id,
   127â†’        )
   128â†’
   129â†’
   130â†’async def _run_pipeline(
   131â†’    graph: Any,
   132â†’    initial_state: dict[str, Any],
   133â†’    config: dict[str, Any],
   134â†’    payload: dict[str, Any],
   135â†’) -> dict[str, Any]:
   136â†’    """Run the pipeline graph with MLflow tracing inside the async context.
   137â†’
   138â†’    MLflow ContextVars must be created in the same async context as the
   139â†’    LangGraph invocation. asyncio.run() creates an isolated context, so
   140â†’    we initialize MLflow tracing HERE (inside asyncio.run) rather than
   141â†’    in the sync caller.
   142â†’    """
   143â†’    if _ensure_mlflow():
   144â†’        import mlflow
   145â†’
   146â†’        mlflow.langchain.autolog()
   147â†’
   148â†’        with mlflow.start_span(
   149â†’            name="protocol_pipeline",
   150â†’            span_type="CHAIN",
   151â†’        ) as span:
   152â†’            # Capture trace_id immediately so finally block can force-close
   153â†’            # orphaned traces on process-kill or unexpected exception.
   154â†’            trace_id = mlflow.get_active_trace_id()
   155â†’            span.set_inputs(
   156â†’                {
   157â†’                    "protocol_id": payload.get("protocol_id", ""),
   158â†’                    "title": payload.get("title", ""),
   159â†’                    "file_uri": payload.get("file_uri", ""),
   160â†’                }
   161â†’            )
   162â†’            succeeded = False
   163â†’            try:
   164â†’                result = await graph.ainvoke(initial_state, config)
   165â†’                span.set_outputs(
   166â†’                    {
   167â†’                        "status": result.get("status"),
   168â†’                        "error": result.get("error"),
   169â†’                        "error_count": len(result.get("errors", [])),
   170â†’                    }
   171â†’                )
   172â†’                succeeded = True
   173â†’                return result
   174â†’            finally:
   175â†’                # Only force-close as ERROR on failure â€” let the context
   176â†’                # manager's __exit__ handle successful traces naturally.
   177â†’                if trace_id and not succeeded:
   178â†’                    logger.warning(
   179â†’                        "Force-closing MLflow trace %s as ERROR (pipeline failed)",
   180â†’                        trace_id,
   181â†’                    )
   182â†’                    try:
   183â†’                        mlflow.MlflowClient().end_trace(trace_id, status="ERROR")
   184â†’                    except Exception:
   185â†’                        logger.warning(
   186â†’                            "Could not force-close MLflow trace %s â€” already closed or unavailable",
   187â†’                            trace_id,
   188â†’                        )
   189â†’
   190â†’    return await graph.ainvoke(initial_state, config)
   191â†’
   192â†’
   193â†’def handle_protocol_uploaded(payload: dict[str, Any]) -> None:
   194â†’    """Handle a ProtocolUploaded event by running the full pipeline.
   195â†’
   196â†’    Constructs the initial PipelineState from the event payload and
   197â†’    invokes the consolidated 5-node LangGraph workflow via asyncio.run().
   198â†’
   199â†’    Uses protocol_id as the LangGraph thread_id so that retry_from_checkpoint
   200â†’    can locate the saved checkpoint by protocol_id alone.
   201â†’
   202â†’    Replaces both extraction_service.trigger.handle_protocol_uploaded and
   203â†’    grounding_service.trigger.handle_criteria_extracted from the v1.x
   204â†’    two-service architecture.
   205â†’
   206â†’    Args:
   207â†’        payload: Event payload dict containing protocol_id, file_uri, and title.
   208â†’
   209â†’    Raises:
   210â†’        Exception: Re-raised after logging to let the outbox processor
   211â†’            mark the event as failed for retry.
   212â†’    """
   213â†’    protocol_id = payload.get("protocol_id", "unknown")
   214â†’    logger.info(
   215â†’        "Handling ProtocolUploaded event for protocol %s (consolidated pipeline)",
   216â†’        protocol_id,
   217â†’    )
   218â†’
   219â†’    try:
   220â†’        # Generate unique thread_id per pipeline run to prevent checkpoint collision
   221â†’        # on re-extraction (same protocol_id would resume old completed checkpoint)
   222â†’        thread_id = f"{protocol_id}:{uuid4()}"
   223â†’
   224â†’        initial_state: dict[str, Any] = {
   225â†’            "protocol_id": payload["protocol_id"],
   226â†’            "file_uri": payload["file_uri"],
   227â†’            "title": payload["title"],
   228â†’            "batch_id": None,
   229â†’            "pdf_bytes": None,
   230â†’            "extraction_json": None,
   231â†’            "entities_json": None,
   232â†’            "grounded_entities_json": None,
   233â†’            "archived_reviewed_criteria": payload.get("archived_reviewed_criteria"),
   234â†’            "status": "processing",
   235â†’            "error": None,
   236â†’            "errors": [],
   237â†’        }
   238â†’
   239â†’        # Store thread_id in protocol metadata for retry_from_checkpoint lookup
   240â†’        try:
   241â†’            with Session(engine) as session:
   242â†’                protocol = session.get(Protocol, protocol_id)
   243â†’                if protocol:
   244â†’                    meta = protocol.metadata_ or {}
   245â†’                    protocol.metadata_ = {
   246â†’                        **meta,
   247â†’                        "pipeline_thread_id": thread_id,
   248â†’                    }
   249â†’                    session.add(protocol)
   250â†’                    session.commit()
   251â†’        except Exception:
   252â†’            logger.warning(
   253â†’                "Failed to store pipeline_thread_id for protocol %s",
   254â†’                protocol_id,
   255â†’            )
   256â†’
   257â†’        # Lazy import to avoid circular imports at module load time
   258â†’        from protocol_processor.graph import get_graph
   259â†’
   260â†’        graph = get_graph()
   261â†’
   262â†’        config = {"configurable": {"thread_id": thread_id}}
   263â†’
   264â†’        asyncio.run(
   265â†’            _run_pipeline(graph, initial_state, config, payload)
   266â†’        )
   267â†’
   268â†’        logger.info(
   269â†’            "Protocol pipeline completed for protocol %s",
   270â†’            protocol_id,
   271â†’        )
   272â†’
   273â†’    except Exception as e:
   274â†’        logger.exception(
   275â†’            "Protocol pipeline failed for protocol %s",
   276â†’            protocol_id,
   277â†’        )
   278â†’        reason = _categorize_pipeline_error(e)
   279â†’        _update_protocol_failed(
   280â†’            protocol_id,
   281â†’            reason,
   282â†’            "pipeline_failed",
   283â†’            type(e).__name__,
   284â†’        )
   285â†’        raise
   286â†’
   287â†’
   288â†’async def retry_from_checkpoint(protocol_id: str) -> dict[str, Any]:
   289â†’    """Resume pipeline from last checkpoint for a failed protocol.
   290â†’
   291â†’    Passes None as the input state to graph.ainvoke, which tells LangGraph
   292â†’    to resume from the last saved checkpoint for the given thread_id instead
   293â†’    of starting from scratch. Reads thread_id from protocol.metadata_ where
   294â†’    it was stored during the original pipeline invocation.
   295â†’
   296â†’    Args:
   297â†’        protocol_id: Protocol ID â€” used to look up thread_id from metadata.
   298â†’
   299â†’    Returns:
   300â†’        Final pipeline state dict after resuming from checkpoint.
   301â†’    """
   302â†’    with Session(engine) as session:
   303â†’        protocol = session.get(Protocol, protocol_id)
   304â†’        if not protocol:
   305â†’            raise ValueError(f"Protocol {protocol_id} not found")
   306â†’        thread_id = (protocol.metadata_ or {}).get("pipeline_thread_id", protocol_id)
   307â†’
   308â†’    from protocol_processor.graph import get_graph
   309â†’
   310â†’    graph = get_graph()
   311â†’    config = {"configurable": {"thread_id": thread_id}}
   312â†’    # Pass None as input â€” LangGraph resumes from last checkpoint
   313â†’    result = await graph.ainvoke(None, config)
   314â†’    return result
   315â†’

content.content:
1â†’"""Ground node: route entities via TerminologyRouter and select with MedGemma.
     2â†’
     3â†’This node is the fourth in the protocol processing pipeline:
     4â†’ingestâ†’extractâ†’parseâ†’groundâ†’persist
     5â†’It implements the delegation pattern: thin orchestration that calls tools.
     6â†’
     7â†’Per user decisions:
     8â†’- Error accumulation: entity failures are logged and accumulated, not fatal
     9â†’- Audit trail: all grounding decisions logged to AuditLog
    10â†’- TerminologyRouter handles entity-type-aware API routing
    11â†’- MedGemma selects the best match from candidates
    12â†’- Field mappings generated per entity for AutoCriteria decomposition
    13â†’- Consent entities skipped explicitly (not groundable to medical codes)
    14â†’- Demographics routed normally via umls/snomed (age/gender agentic reasoning)
    15â†’- Agentic retry loop: max 3 attempts, expert_review routing on exhaustion
    16â†’
    17â†’Architecture note: Graph nodes ARE allowed to import from api-service for DB access.
    18â†’"""
    19â†’
    20â†’from __future__ import annotations
    21â†’
    22â†’import json
    23â†’import logging
    24â†’from typing import Any
    25â†’
    26â†’from api_service.storage import engine
    27â†’from shared.models import AuditLog
    28â†’from sqlmodel import Session
    29â†’
    30â†’from protocol_processor.schemas.grounding import EntityGroundingResult
    31â†’from protocol_processor.state import PipelineState
    32â†’from protocol_processor.tools.field_mapper import generate_field_mappings
    33â†’from protocol_processor.tools.medgemma_decider import (
    34â†’    agentic_reasoning_loop,
    35â†’    medgemma_decide,
    36â†’)
    37â†’from protocol_processor.tools.terminology_router import TerminologyRouter
    38â†’
    39â†’logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    40â†’
    41â†’# Singleton router instance (loads YAML config once)
    42â†’_router: TerminologyRouter | None = None
    43â†’
    44â†’
    45â†’def _get_router() -> TerminologyRouter:
    46â†’    """Get or create the singleton TerminologyRouter."""
    47â†’    global _router  # noqa: PLW0603
    48â†’    if _router is None:
    49â†’        _router = TerminologyRouter()
    50â†’    return _router
    51â†’
    52â†’
    53â†’def _log_grounding_audit(
    54â†’    session: Session,
    55â†’    protocol_id: str,
    56â†’    criterion_id: str,
    57â†’    entity: dict[str, Any],
    58â†’    candidates: list[Any],
    59â†’    result: Any,
    60â†’) -> None:
    61â†’    """Create an AuditLog entry for a grounding decision.
    62â†’
    63â†’    Records full details: entity, all candidates considered, selected code,
    64â†’    reasoning, and confidence. Provides the audit trail per user decision:
    65â†’    "All agent exchanges (MedGemma decisions, API calls, routing) are logged."
    66â†’
    67â†’    Args:
    68â†’        session: Active SQLModel session.
    69â†’        protocol_id: Protocol ID for context.
    70â†’        criterion_id: Criterion ID this entity belongs to.
    71â†’        entity: Entity dict from entities_json.
    72â†’        candidates: GroundingCandidate objects from TerminologyRouter.
    73â†’        result: EntityGroundingResult from medgemma_decide.
    74â†’    """
    75â†’    audit = AuditLog(
    76â†’        event_type="entity_grounded",
    77â†’        target_type="criteria",
    78â†’        target_id=criterion_id,
    79â†’        details={
    80â†’            "protocol_id": protocol_id,
    81â†’            "entity_text": result.entity_text,
    82â†’            "entity_type": result.entity_type,
    83â†’            "candidate_count": len(candidates),
    84â†’            "candidates": [
    85â†’                {
    86â†’                    "source_api": c.source_api,
    87â†’                    "code": c.code,
    88â†’                    "preferred_term": c.preferred_term,
    89â†’                    "score": c.score,
    90â†’                }
    91â†’                for c in candidates
    92â†’            ],
    93â†’            "selected_code": result.selected_code,
    94â†’            "selected_system": result.selected_system,
    95â†’            "preferred_term": result.preferred_term,
    96â†’            "confidence": result.confidence,
    97â†’            "reasoning": result.reasoning,
    98â†’        },
    99â†’    )
   100â†’    session.add(audit)
   101â†’
   102â†’
   103â†’async def _ground_entity_with_retry(
   104â†’    entity: dict[str, Any],
   105â†’    router: TerminologyRouter,
   106â†’    criterion_text: str,
   107â†’) -> EntityGroundingResult:
   108â†’    """Ground a single entity with agentic retry loop (max 3 attempts).
   109â†’
   110â†’    Implements the MedGemma agentic reasoning loop:
   111â†’    1. Initial grounding via TerminologyRouter + MedGemma
   112â†’    2. If low confidence, ask MedGemma 3 questions (valid? derived? rephrase?)
   113â†’    3. Retry with reformulated query (up to 2 more attempts, 3 total)
   114â†’    4. After 3 failed attempts, mark for expert_review
   115â†’
   116â†’    Args:
   117â†’        entity: Entity dict with text, entity_type, criterion_id.
   118â†’        router: TerminologyRouter singleton for API dispatch.
   119â†’        criterion_text: Full criterion text for context.
   120â†’
   121â†’    Returns:
   122â†’        EntityGroundingResult. May have expert_review marker in reasoning.
   123â†’    """
   124â†’    entity_text = entity.get("text", "")
   125â†’    entity_type = entity.get("entity_type", "")
   126â†’
   127â†’    # Step 1: Route entity through TerminologyRouter to get candidates
   128â†’    candidates = await router.route_entity(entity_text, entity_type)
   129â†’
   130â†’    # Log when TerminologyRouter returns empty
   131â†’    if not candidates:
   132â†’        apis = router.get_apis_for_entity(entity_type)
   133â†’        if not apis:
   134â†’            logger.info(
   135â†’                "Entity '%s' (type=%s) skipped by TerminologyRouter"
   136â†’                " â€” no APIs configured for this type",
   137â†’                entity_text[:50],
   138â†’                entity_type,
   139â†’            )
   140â†’        else:
   141â†’            logger.info(
   142â†’                "Entity '%s' (type=%s) returned zero candidates from all APIs",
   143â†’                entity_text[:50],
   144â†’                entity_type,
   145â†’            )
   146â†’
   147â†’    # Step 2: MedGemma selects best match from candidates
   148â†’    result = await medgemma_decide(entity, candidates, criterion_text)
   149â†’
   150â†’    # Step 3: Agentic retry loop â€” max 3 attempts total
   151â†’    attempt = 1
   152â†’    current_query = entity_text
   153â†’    while (
   154â†’        result.selected_code is None
   155â†’        and result.confidence < 0.5
   156â†’        and attempt < 3
   157â†’        and router.get_apis_for_entity(entity_type)
   158â†’    ):
   159â†’        attempt += 1
   160â†’        reasoning_result = await agentic_reasoning_loop(
   161â†’            entity={**entity, "_previous_query": current_query},
   162â†’            criterion_context=criterion_text,
   163â†’            router=router,
   164â†’            attempt=attempt,
   165â†’        )
   166â†’
   167â†’        if reasoning_result.should_skip:
   168â†’            logger.info(
   169â†’                "Entity '%s' marked non-medical by agentic reasoning"
   170â†’                " (attempt %d) â€” skipping",
   171â†’                entity_text[:50],
   172â†’                attempt,
   173â†’            )
   174â†’            return EntityGroundingResult(
   175â†’                entity_text=entity_text,
   176â†’                entity_type=entity_type,
   177â†’                selected_code=None,
   178â†’                selected_system=None,
   179â†’                preferred_term=None,
   180â†’                confidence=0.0,
   181â†’                candidates=[],
   182â†’                reasoning=(
   183â†’                    f"Skipped by agentic reasoning (attempt {attempt}): "
   184â†’                    f"{reasoning_result.reasoning}"
   185â†’                ),
   186â†’            )
   187â†’
   188â†’        new_query = (
   189â†’            reasoning_result.rephrased_query
   190â†’            or reasoning_result.derived_term
   191â†’            or reasoning_result.gemini_suggestion
   192â†’            or current_query
   193â†’        )
   194â†’        current_query = new_query
   195â†’
   196â†’        logger.info(
   197â†’            "Agentic retry (attempt %d) for '%s' using query '%s'",
   198â†’            attempt,
   199â†’            entity_text[:50],
   200â†’            new_query[:50],
   201â†’        )
   202â†’
   203â†’        new_candidates = await router.route_entity(new_query, entity_type)
   204â†’        if new_candidates:
   205â†’            retry_entity = {**entity, "text": new_query}
   206â†’            result = await medgemma_decide(retry_entity, new_candidates, criterion_text)
   207â†’            if result.selected_code and result.confidence >= 0.5:
   208â†’                # Success â€” preserve original entity_text
   209â†’                return EntityGroundingResult(
   210â†’                    entity_text=entity_text,
   211â†’                    entity_type=result.entity_type,
   212â†’                    selected_code=result.selected_code,
   213â†’                    selected_system=result.selected_system,
   214â†’                    preferred_term=result.preferred_term,
   215â†’                    confidence=result.confidence,
   216â†’                    candidates=result.candidates,
   217â†’                    reasoning=(
   218â†’                        f"[Attempt {attempt}, query='{new_query}'] "
   219â†’                        f"{result.reasoning}"
   220â†’                    ),
   221â†’                    field_mappings=result.field_mappings,
   222â†’                )
   223â†’
   224â†’    # Route to expert_review if all attempts exhausted without success
   225â†’    if result.selected_code is None and attempt >= 2:
   226â†’        logger.warning(
   227â†’            "Entity '%s' (type=%s) routed to expert_review after"
   228â†’            " %d failed grounding attempts",
   229â†’            entity_text[:50],
   230â†’            entity_type,
   231â†’            attempt,
   232â†’        )
   233â†’        return EntityGroundingResult(
   234â†’            entity_text=result.entity_text,
   235â†’            entity_type=result.entity_type,
   236â†’            selected_code=result.selected_code,
   237â†’            selected_system=result.selected_system,
   238â†’            preferred_term=result.preferred_term,
   239â†’            confidence=result.confidence,
   240â†’            candidates=result.candidates,
   241â†’            reasoning=(
   242â†’                f"[expert_review] Routed to expert review after "
   243â†’                f"{attempt} failed grounding attempts. "
   244â†’                f"Last reasoning: {result.reasoning}"
   245â†’            ),
   246â†’        )
   247â†’
   248â†’    return result
   249â†’
   250â†’
   251â†’async def ground_node(state: PipelineState) -> dict[str, Any]:
   252â†’    """Ground entities via TerminologyRouter + MedGemma.
   253â†’
   254â†’    Parses entities_json from state, routes each entity through TerminologyRouter
   255â†’    to get terminology candidates, then passes candidates to medgemma_decide for
   256â†’    best-match selection. Generates field mappings for each successfully grounded
   257â†’    entity.
   258â†’
   259â†’    Error accumulation: individual entity failures are logged and collected in
   260â†’    errors list. Processing continues with remaining entities. Only a total
   261â†’    failure to parse entities_json triggers a fatal error.
   262â†’
   263â†’    Args:
   264â†’        state: Current pipeline state with entities_json and protocol_id.
   265â†’
   266â†’    Returns:
   267â†’        Dict with grounded_entities_json and accumulated errors list,
   268â†’        or fatal error dict if entities_json cannot be parsed.
   269â†’    """
   270â†’    from protocol_processor.tracing import pipeline_span
   271â†’
   272â†’    if state.get("error"):
   273â†’        return {}
   274â†’
   275â†’    with pipeline_span("ground_node", span_type="TOOL") as span:
   276â†’        span.set_inputs({"protocol_id": state.get("protocol_id", "")})
   277â†’
   278â†’        try:
   279â†’            entities_json = state.get("entities_json")
   280â†’            if not entities_json:
   281â†’                span.set_outputs({"error": "No entities_json in state"})
   282â†’                return {"error": "No entities_json in state â€” parse node may have failed"}
   283â†’
   284â†’            entity_items: list[dict[str, Any]] = json.loads(entities_json)
   285â†’            protocol_id = state["protocol_id"]
   286â†’
   287â†’            span.set_inputs({
   288â†’                "protocol_id": protocol_id,
   289â†’                "entity_count": len(entity_items),
   290â†’            })
   291â†’
   292â†’            logger.info(
   293â†’                "Starting grounding for protocol %s: %d entities",
   294â†’                protocol_id,
   295â†’                len(entity_items),
   296â†’            )
   297â†’
   298â†’            router = _get_router()
   299â†’            accumulated_errors: list[str] = list(state.get("errors") or [])
   300â†’            grounding_results: list[dict[str, Any]] = []
   301â†’
   302â†’            for idx, entity in enumerate(entity_items, 1):

1â†’"""Shared resilience patterns: circuit breakers and retry helpers.
     2â†’
     3â†’Per-service circuit breakers for GCS, Gemini, UMLS MCP, and Vertex AI.
     4â†’Each breaker trips after 3 consecutive failures (per CONTEXT.md decision)
     5â†’and recovers after 60 seconds (Claude's discretion).
     6â†’"""
     7â†’
     8â†’import logging
     9â†’import os
    10â†’
    11â†’from pybreaker import CircuitBreaker, CircuitBreakerListener
    12â†’
    13â†’logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)
    14â†’
    15â†’# Recovery timeout: 60 seconds per research recommendation
    16â†’_RECOVERY_TIMEOUT = 60
    17â†’# Failure threshold: 3 consecutive failures per CONTEXT.md decision
    18â†’_FAIL_MAX = 3
    19â†’
    20â†’
    21â†’class MLflowCircuitBreakerListener(CircuitBreakerListener):
    22â†’    """Log circuit breaker state changes to MLflow.
    23â†’
    24â†’    Records when breakers trip (open), recover (half_open -> closed),
    25â†’    or probe (half_open). Safe no-op if MLflow unavailable.
    26â†’    """
    27â†’
    28â†’    def state_change(self, cb, old_state, new_state):  # type: ignore[override]
    29â†’        """Handle circuit breaker state change by logging to MLflow."""
    30â†’        try:
    31â†’            import mlflow
    32â†’
    33â†’            tracking_uri = os.getenv("MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI")
    34â†’            if not tracking_uri:
    35â†’                return
    36â†’
    37â†’            with mlflow.start_span(
    38â†’                name=f"circuit_breaker_{cb.name}",
    39â†’                span_type="TOOL",
    40â†’            ) as span:
    41â†’                span.set_inputs(
    42â†’                    {
    43â†’                        "service": cb.name,
    44â†’                        "old_state": str(old_state),
    45â†’                        "new_state": str(new_state),
    46â†’                        "fail_counter": cb.fail_counter,
    47â†’                    }
    48â†’                )
    49â†’        except Exception:
    50â†’            logger.debug("MLflow circuit breaker logging failed", exc_info=True)
    51â†’
    52â†’
    53â†’# Create listener instance
    54â†’_mlflow_listener = MLflowCircuitBreakerListener()
    55â†’
    56â†’gemini_breaker = CircuitBreaker(
    57â†’    fail_max=_FAIL_MAX,
    58â†’    reset_timeout=_RECOVERY_TIMEOUT,
    59â†’    name="gemini",
    60â†’    listeners=[_mlflow_listener],
    61â†’)
    62â†’
    63â†’umls_breaker = CircuitBreaker(
    64â†’    fail_max=_FAIL_MAX,
    65â†’    reset_timeout=_RECOVERY_TIMEOUT,
    66â†’    name="umls",
    67â†’    listeners=[_mlflow_listener],
    68â†’)
    69â†’
    70â†’gcs_breaker = CircuitBreaker(
    71â†’    fail_max=_FAIL_MAX,
    72â†’    reset_timeout=_RECOVERY_TIMEOUT,
    73â†’    name="gcs",
    74â†’    listeners=[_mlflow_listener],
    75â†’)
    76â†’
    77â†’vertex_ai_breaker = CircuitBreaker(
    78â†’    fail_max=_FAIL_MAX,
    79â†’    reset_timeout=_RECOVERY_TIMEOUT,
    80â†’    name="vertex_ai",
    81â†’    listeners=[_mlflow_listener],
    82â†’)
    83â†’
    84â†’# ToolUniverse circuit breaker â€” higher fail threshold (10 vs 3) because
    85â†’# ToolUniverse wraps multiple APIs and transient failures are more common.
    86â†’# fail_max=10 per user decision (NOT reusing _FAIL_MAX=3 from other breakers).
    87â†’tu_breaker = CircuitBreaker(

# MLflow's trace context uses Python ContextVars which do NOT propagate
# across asyncio task boundaries created by asyncio.create_task() or

"""Tests for sentence-length entity extraction preprocessing."""
from protocol_processor.tools.tooluniverse_client import _extract_term_from_sentence


def test_short_query_unchanged():
    """Short queries (< 4 words OR < 40 chars) pass through unchanged."""
    assert _extract_term_from_sentence("eGFR") == "eGFR"
    assert _extract_term_from_sentence("osteoarthritis") == "osteoarthritis"
    assert _extract_term_from_sentence("ACE inhibitor") == "ACE inhibitor"


def test_sentence_length_extraction():
    """Sentence-length queries (>= 4 words AND >= 40 chars) have preamble stripped."""
    result = _extract_term_from_sentence(
        "The patient must have a diagnosis of myocardial infarction"
    )
    # Should extract the medical term, not the full sentence
    assert len(result.split()) < 8  # Significantly shorter than input (10 words)
    assert len(result) >= 3  # Not empty


def test_preamble_removal():
    """Common clinical preambles matching _PREAMBLE_PATTERN are stripped."""
    result = _extract_term_from_sentence(
        "History of myocardial infarction within 6 months"
    )
    # "History of" is a known preamble â€” should be stripped
    assert "myocardial infarction" in result.lower() or len(result.split()) <= 6


def test_fallback_last_words():
    """When no preamble match, last 4 words are returned as fallback."""
    result = _extract_term_from_sentence(
        "Something unusual and completely unrecognizable medical condition here"
    )
    words = result.split()
    assert len(words) <= 4


def test_whitespace_handling():
    """Leading/trailing whitespace is stripped."""
    assert _extract_term_from_sentence("  eGFR  ") == "eGFR"

input.content:
"""Tests for circuit breaker behavior in resilience module."""
import pybreaker
import pytest

from shared.resilience import tu_breaker, gemini_breaker


class _SimulatedError(Exception):
    pass


def test_tu_breaker_config():
    """ToolUniverse breaker has fail_max=10, reset_timeout=60."""
    assert tu_breaker._fail_max == 10
    assert tu_breaker._reset_timeout == 60


def test_gemini_breaker_config():
    """Gemini breaker has fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60."""
    assert gemini_breaker._fail_max == 3
    assert gemini_breaker._reset_timeout == 60


def test_breaker_opens_after_failures():
    """A fresh breaker opens after fail_max consecutive failures."""
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60, name="test_phase44_open"
    )

    @test_breaker
    def failing_call():
        raise _SimulatedError("boom")

    # Trip the breaker with fail_max failures
    for _ in range(3):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            failing_call()

    # Next call should be rejected by the open breaker
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        failing_call()


def test_breaker_rejects_during_open():
    """Open breaker rejects calls without executing the function."""
    call_count = 0
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=2, reset_timeout=300, name="test_phase44_reject"
    )

    @test_breaker
    def counting_call():
        nonlocal call_count
        call_count += 1
        raise _SimulatedError("boom")

    # Trip breaker
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            counting_call()

    assert call_count == 2

    # Open breaker rejects without calling the function
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        counting_call()

    assert call_count == 2  # Not incremented â€” function was not called


def test_breaker_success_resets_count():
    """Successful calls reset the failure count."""
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60, name="test_phase44_reset"
    )
    fail = False

    @test_breaker
    def maybe_fail():
        if fail:
            raise _SimulatedError("boom")
        return "ok"

    # 2 failures (not enough to trip)
    fail = True
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            maybe_fail()

    # 1 success resets count
    fail = False
    assert maybe_fail() == "ok"

    # 2 more failures â€” still not tripped (count was reset)
    fail = True
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            maybe_fail()

    # Should still be closed (2 < fail_max=3)
    fail = False
    assert maybe_fail() == "ok"

async def _ground_entity_parallel(
    entity: dict[str, Any],
    router: TerminologyRouter,
    criterion_text: str,
    entity_num: int,
    total: int,
    semaphore: asyncio.Semaphore,
) -> tuple[EntityGroundingResult | None, str | None]:
    """Ground a single entity with concurrency control and timing.

    Acquires the semaphore before grounding to cap concurrent API calls.
    Returns a (result, error) tuple for error isolation -- one entity failure
    does not crash others in the asyncio.gather batch.

    Args:
        entity: Entity dict with text, entity_type, criterion_id.
        router: TerminologyRouter singleton for API dispatch.
        criterion_text: Full criterion text for context.
        entity_num: 1-based index for logging.
        total: Total entity count for logging.
        semaphore: Concurrency limiter (Semaphore(4)).

    Returns:
        (EntityGroundingResult, None) on success, or (None, error_message) on failure.
    """
    async with semaphore:
        entity_text = entity.get("text", "")[:50]
        entity_type = entity.get("entity_type", "")
        start = time.monotonic()
        logger.info(
            "Grounding entity %d/%d: '%s' (type=%s) â€” start",
            entity_num, total, entity_text, entity_type,
        )
        try:
            result = await _ground_entity_with_retry(entity, router, criterion_text)
            elapsed = time.monotonic() - start
            logger.info(
                "Entity %d/%d '%s' grounded in %.1fs: code=%s, conf=%.2f",
                entity_num, total, entity_text, elapsed,
                result.selected_code or "N/A",
                result.confidence,
            )
            return (result, None)
        except Exception as e:
            elapsed = time.monotonic() - start
            logger.error(
                "Entity %d/%d '%s' failed in %.1fs: %s",
                entity_num, total, entity_text, elapsed, e,
            )
            return (None, str(e))


async def ground_node(state: PipelineState) -> dict[str, Any]:

                        )
                        grounding_results.append(result.model_dump())

                    # Ground with agentic retry (up to 3 attempts, expert_review on failure)
                    result = await _ground_entity_with_retry(entity, router, criterion_text)

                    # Generate field mappings for this entity
                    field_mappings = await generate_field_mappings(result, criterion_text)
                    result.field_mappings = field_mappings if field_mappings else None

                    # Log grounding decision to AuditLog
                    try:
                        with Session(engine) as session:
                            _log_grounding_audit(

                                criterion_id,
                                entity,
                                result.candidates,
                                result,
                            )
                            session.commit()
                    except Exception as audit_error:
                        # Audit log failures should not block grounding
                        logger.warning(
                            "Failed to write AuditLog for entity '%s': %s",
                            entity_text[:50],
                            audit_error,
                        )

                    # Collect result
                    grounding_results.append(result.model_dump())

                    logger.info(

                        entity_text[:50],
                        result.selected_code,
                        result.confidence,
                    )

                except Exception as e:
                    cid_short = criterion_id[:12] if criterion_id else "unknown"
                    error_msg = (
                        f"Entity grounding failed for '{entity_text[:50]}'"
                        f" (criterion={cid_short}): {e}"
                    )
                    logger.error(error_msg, exc_info=True)
                    accumulated_errors.append(error_msg)
                    # Continue with remaining entities (error accumulation)
                    continue

router = _get_router()
            accumulated_errors: list[str] = list(state.get("errors") or [])
            grounding_results: list[dict[str, Any]] = []

            # Pre-process: handle consent entities synchronously (skip grounding)
            entities_to_ground: list[tuple[int, dict[str, Any]]] = []
            for idx, entity in enumerate(entity_items, 1):
                entity_text = entity.get("text", "")
                entity_type = entity.get("entity_type", "")

                if entity_type == "Consent":
                    logger.info(
                        "Entity '%s' (type=Consent) skipped â€” consent/participation"
                        " criteria are not groundable to terminology codes",
                        entity_text[:50],
                    )
                    consent_result = EntityGroundingResult(
                        entity_text=entity_text,
                        entity_type=entity_type,
                        selected_code=None,
                        selected_system=None,
                        preferred_term=None,
                        confidence=0.0,
                        candidates=[],
                        reasoning=(
                            "Consent/participation criterion â€” not groundable"
                            " to medical terminology codes"
                        ),
                    )
                    grounding_results.append(consent_result.model_dump())
                else:
                    entities_to_ground.append((idx, entity))

            # Parallel grounding with asyncio.gather + semaphore
            # Semaphore created here (not module-level) to bind to current event loop
            semaphore = asyncio.Semaphore(4)

            tasks = [
                _ground_entity_parallel(
                    entity,
                    router,
                    entity.get("criterion_text") or entity.get("text", ""),
                    idx,
                    len(entity_items),
                    semaphore,
                )
                for idx, entity in entities_to_ground
            ]

            outcomes = await asyncio.gather(*tasks)

            # Process outcomes
            for (idx, entity), (result, error) in zip(entities_to_ground, outcomes):
                entity_text = entity.get("text", "")
                criterion_id = entity.get("criterion_id", "")
                criterion_text = entity.get("criterion_text") or entity.get("text", "")

                if result is not None:
                    # Generate field mappings for this entity
                    field_mappings = await generate_field_mappings(result, criterion_text)
                    result.field_mappings = field_mappings if field_mappings else None

                    # Log grounding decision to AuditLog
                    try:
                        with Session(engine) as session:
                            _log_grounding_audit(
                                session,
                                protocol_id,
                                criterion_id,
                                entity,
                                result.candidates,
                                result,
                            )
                            session.commit()
                    except Exception as audit_error:
                        logger.warning(
                            "Failed to write AuditLog for entity '%s': %s",
                            entity_text[:50],
                            audit_error,
                        )

                    grounding_results.append(result.model_dump())
                else:
                    # Entity failed â€” create expert_review fallback
                    cid_short = criterion_id[:12] if criterion_id else "unknown"
                    error_msg = (
                        f"Entity grounding failed for '{entity_text[:50]}'"
                        f" (criterion={cid_short}): {error}"
                    )
                    logger.error(error_msg)
                    accumulated_errors.append(error_msg)

input.content:
"""Tests for circuit breaker behavior in resilience module."""
import pybreaker
import pytest

from shared.resilience import tu_breaker, gemini_breaker


class _SimulatedError(Exception):
    pass


def test_tu_breaker_config():
    """ToolUniverse breaker has fail_max=10, reset_timeout=60."""
    assert tu_breaker._fail_max == 10
    assert tu_breaker._reset_timeout == 60


def test_gemini_breaker_config():
    """Gemini breaker has fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60."""
    assert gemini_breaker._fail_max == 3
    assert gemini_breaker._reset_timeout == 60


def test_breaker_opens_after_failures():
    """A fresh breaker opens after fail_max consecutive failures.

    pybreaker raises CircuitBreakerError on the fail_max'th call itself
    (wrapping the original exception), then pure CircuitBreakerError on
    subsequent calls while open.
    """
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60, name="test_phase44_open"
    )

    @test_breaker
    def failing_call():
        raise _SimulatedError("boom")

    # First (fail_max - 1) failures raise the original exception
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            failing_call()

    # fail_max'th failure raises CircuitBreakerError (breaker trips)
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        failing_call()

    # Subsequent calls also raise CircuitBreakerError (breaker is open)
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        failing_call()


def test_breaker_rejects_during_open():
    """Open breaker rejects calls without executing the function."""
    call_count = 0
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=2, reset_timeout=300, name="test_phase44_reject"
    )

    @test_breaker
    def counting_call():
        nonlocal call_count
        call_count += 1
        raise _SimulatedError("boom")

    # First failure raises original exception
    with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
        counting_call()
    assert call_count == 1

    # Second failure (fail_max) trips the breaker
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        counting_call()
    assert call_count == 2  # Function WAS called (breaker trips after)

    # Open breaker rejects without calling the function
    with pytest.raises(pybreaker.CircuitBreakerError):
        counting_call()
    assert call_count == 2  # Not incremented â€” function was not called


def test_breaker_success_resets_count():
    """Successful calls reset the failure count."""
    test_breaker = pybreaker.CircuitBreaker(
        fail_max=3, reset_timeout=60, name="test_phase44_reset"
    )
    fail = False

    @test_breaker
    def maybe_fail():
        if fail:
            raise _SimulatedError("boom")
        return "ok"

    # 2 failures (not enough to trip â€” need 3)
    fail = True
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            maybe_fail()

    # 1 success resets count
    fail = False
    assert maybe_fail() == "ok"

    # 2 more failures â€” still not tripped (count was reset)
    fail = True
    for _ in range(2):
        with pytest.raises(_SimulatedError):
            maybe_fail()

    # Should still be closed (2 < fail_max=3)
    fail = False
    assert maybe_fail() == "ok"

    48â†’
    49â†’**v2.1 Roadmap (2026-02-17):**
    50â†’- Phase 36 â†’ 37 are the E2E pytest track (markers + fixtures first, then assertions + baseline)
    51â†’- Phase 38 â†’ 39 are the quality evaluation track (report script first, then bug catalog section)
    52â†’- Tracks run independently; execution order is 36 â†’ 37 then 38 â†’ 39 (or in parallel)
    53â†’- Quality script reads from existing DB output or triggers new pipeline runs on 2-3 PDFs from data/protocols/
    54â†’- E2E tests require Docker Compose running (real PostgreSQL + real Gemini API); skip marker when not available
    55â†’
    56â†’**v2.0 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    57â†’- Two-model architecture: MedGemma for medical reasoning, Gemini for JSON structuring
    58â†’- uuid4 thread_id per pipeline run prevents checkpoint collision on re-extraction
    59â†’- NLM direct APIs (RxNorm/ICD-10/LOINC/HPO) over ToolUniverse â€” free, no-auth, well-documented
    60â†’- Read-only AI criterion re-run: Gemini proposes, reviewer commits via existing action endpoint
    61â†’- [Phase 39]: Bug Catalog placed after LLM Assessment; orphan detection skipped per plan constraints
    62â†’
    63â†’**Phase 40-01 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    64â†’- All 6 terminology systems accessed via ToolUniverse SDK (single dependency, single pattern)
    65â†’- TTLCache(ttl=300) for autocomplete caching â€” 5-minute TTL appropriate for real-time use
    66â†’- Demographic entities routed to umls+snomed (NOT skipped); MedGemma handles derived mapping
    67â†’- Consent entities skipped before grounding â€” not groundable to medical terminology codes
    68â†’- MedGemma 3-question agentic reasoning loop in single prompt (minimize token usage)
    69â†’- Gemini collaborates on reasoning structuring via gemini_suggestion field
    70â†’- expert_review routing as reasoning string marker (not new field) â€” avoids schema change
    71â†’
    72â†’**Phase 40-02 Key Decisions (2026-02-17):**
    73â†’- Docker container is running stale pre-Phase-40 image; code verification done via direct uv run calls (correct approach)
    74â†’- 5/5 tested systems return real codes (ICD10, RxNorm, HPO, LOINC, UMLS) â€” all pass, plan required only 3
    75â†’- [Phase 40]: Docker container running stale pre-Phase-40 image; code verification done via direct uv run calls (correct approach)
    76â†’- [Phase 40]: 5/5 tested systems return real codes (ICD10, RxNorm, HPO, LOINC, UMLS) â€” all pass, plan required only 3
    77â†’
    78â†’**Phase 42-01 Key Decisions (2026-02-18):**
    79â†’- end_trace() inside finally is a no-op when span closes normally via context manager â€” safe to always call
    80â†’- MLFLOW_TRACE_TIMEOUT_SECONDS=300 is safety net only (process-kill), not primary fix (try/finally is primary)
    81â†’- Bind mount (../data/uploads:/app/uploads) over named volume â€” dev workflow benefits from browsable host directory
    82â†’- SHA-256 symlink deduplication preserves URI compatibility while saving disk space via .hash-index.json
    83â†’- [Phase 42]: tu_breaker uses fail_max=10 (not 3 like other breakers) â€” ToolUniverse wraps multiple APIs, higher tolerance appropriate
    84â†’- [Phase 42]: Decorator order: @tu_breaker (outer) + @retry (inner) â€” 3 retries count as 1 circuit failure, prevents premature circuit open
    85â†’- [Phase 42]: 503 for circuit-open, 502 for service error â€” frontend tracks these separately for amber indicator
    86â†’- [Phase 42]: Sentence extraction with preamble regex + 4-word fallback to reduce 422 errors from full eligibility criterion text submitted as search queries
    87â†’- [Phase 43]: archive_protocol only accepts dead_letter/extraction_failed/grounding_failed â€” returns 400 for all other states
    88â†’- [Phase 43]: Deduplication uses MAX(created_at) subquery join + separate COUNT subquery for version_count (two-pass approach)
    89â†’- [Phase 43]: old_status captured before protocol.status mutation so audit log records actual transition
    90â†’- [Phase 43]: useProtocolList queryKey includes deduplicate param to ensure cache isolation
